# Council of Ministers / Majlis Al-Wuzara <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Decree-Law No. 69 of 2025
### Amending Certain Provisions of Law No. 2 of 2016
### Regarding the Establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority and Provisions Related to Financial Disclosure

*   Having reviewed the Constitution,
*   And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024,
*   And Penal Law issued by Law No. (16) of 1960, and its amending laws,
*   And Criminal Procedures and Trials Law issued by Law No. (17) of 1960, and its amending laws,
*   And Law No. (24) of 1962 regarding Clubs and Public Benefit Associations,
*   And Decree-Law No. (24) of 1979 regarding Cooperative Societies, and its amending laws,
*   And Decree-Law No. (23) of 1990 regarding the Law on the Organization of the Judiciary, and its amending laws,
*   And Law No. (20) of 2014 regarding Electronic Transactions,
*   And Law No. (2) of 2016 regarding the Establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority / Al-Hai'a Al-Amma li-Mukafahat Al-Fasad <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and Provisions Related to Financial Disclosure,
*   And Bankruptcy Law issued by Law No. (71) of 2020,
*   And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations and its amending decrees,
*   And upon the submission of the Minister of Justice / Wazir Al-Adl <orig>وزير العدل</orig>,
*   And after the approval of the Council of Ministers / Majlis Al-Wuzara <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
*   We have issued the following Decree-Law:

(Article One)
The texts of Articles (1, 2, 5 item 2, 6, 9, 14, 32 item 2, 45 first paragraph) of the aforementioned Law No. (2) of 2016 shall be replaced with the following texts:

(Article 1)
For the purposes of applying the provisions of this Law, the words and phrases listed below shall have the meaning indicated next to each, unless the context of the text requires otherwise:

*   The Authority: The Public Anti-Corruption Authority / Al-Hai'a Al-Amma li-Mukafahat Al-Fasad <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>.
<page_end>1</page_end>

*   Competent Minister: Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>.
*   The Council: The Authority's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الهيئة</orig>.
*   The Chairman: The Chairman of the Authority <orig>رئيس الهيئة</orig>, and the Chairman of the Council <orig>رئيس المجلس</orig>.
*   The Convention: The United Nations Convention against Corruption <orig>اتفاقية الأمم المتحدة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>.
*   Illicit Gain: Any increase in wealth or decrease in liabilities that occurs – due to holding office or assuming a capacity – for a person subject to this law, their minor children, or anyone for whom they are a guardian, custodian, or trustee, whenever it is disproportionate to their resources and unjustified.
*   Public Official: Anyone who holds a civil or military position in government entities, regardless of the nature of their work or job title, or anyone considered a public official among the persons stipulated in Article (43) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>.
*   Financial Disclosure: All monetary, real estate, or movable assets, inside and outside Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>, belonging to a person subject to the provisions of this law, their minor children, and anyone for whom they are a guardian, custodian, or trustee. This includes their rights and their debts to third parties, as well as agencies or authorizations with financial effect issued by them to others or by others in their favor, and usufruct rights.
*   Report: Information or notification submitted to the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> by a natural or legal person containing information they possess about the occurrence of a corruption crime, an attempt to commit it, concealment of its commission, disposal of its evidence, tools, or proceeds, or the commission of a serious financial violation.
*   Whistleblower: The person who reports any corruption crime, and this applies to witnesses, victims of the crime, and experts who provide testimony related to criminalized acts of corruption.
*   Proceeds of Corruption: Properties and assets of all kinds, movable and immovable, tangible and intangible, and any benefits and returns resulting therefrom, obtained by any person directly or indirectly as a result of committing a corruption crime, including legal documents and papers that prove ownership of such properties and assets or prove the rights associated therewith.

(Article (2))
The provisions of this law apply to the following categories:

1.  The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>, Deputy Prime Minister <orig>نائب رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>, Ministers <orig>الوزراء</orig>, and anyone holding an executive position with the rank of minister.
2.  The Speaker <orig>رئيس مجلس الأمة</orig>, Deputy Speaker <orig>نائب رئيس مجلس الأمة</orig>, and members of the National Assembly <orig>مجلس الأمة</orig>.
3.  The President <orig>رئيس المجلس الأعلى للقضاء</orig> and members of the Supreme Judicial Council <orig>المجلس الأعلى للقضاء</orig>, the President <orig>رئيس المحكمة الدستورية</orig> and advisors of the Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig>, advisors of the Court of Cassation <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig> and the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig>, judges <orig>القضاة</orig>, members of the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig>, and the Head <orig>رئيس إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig> and members of the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig>.
4.  The Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> and members of both the General Department of Investigations <orig>الإدارة العامة للتحقيقات</orig> in the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> and the Legal Department <orig>الإدارة القانونية</orig> in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.

5. Arbitrators and experts at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, liquidators, judicial custodians, and trustees stipulated in the aforementioned Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, and notaries public and clerks of justice in the Real Estate Registration and Notarization Sector <orig>قطاع التسجيل العقاري والتوثيق</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
6. Chairman, Vice-Chairman, and members of the Municipal Council <orig>المجلس البلدي</orig>.
7. Chairmen and members of councils, bodies, and committees that undertake executive tasks and whose formation or appointment of members is issued by a law, decree, or decision from the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>.
8. Head of the Financial Controllers Authority <orig>جهاز المراقبين الماليين</orig>, his deputies, heads of sectors within the Authority, and financial controllers.
9. Leaders, who are:
    - Occupants of leadership positions in the general salary scale (Excellent Grade / Undersecretary / Assistant Undersecretary).
    - Members of boards of directors, general managers and their deputies or assistants, and secretaries-general and their deputies or assistants in public authorities or institutions or any government entity.
    - Those considered leaders, such as heads of entities and their deputies, or administrative units, or delegated members in public authorities and institutions.
    - Directors of departments and those considered equivalent, such as heads of organizational units approved in their structures at a departmental level or higher.
    The provision of the preceding two clauses applies to military personnel, diplomats, and civilians in ministries, government departments, public authorities and institutions, and entities with annexed or independent budgets, whenever they undertake responsibilities or enjoy the benefits prescribed for the position, whether their occupation of the position is original or temporary.
    The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, in coordination with the relevant entities, shall periodically identify and update the occupants of these positions subject to the provisions of this Law.
10. Chairman, Vice-Chairman, members of the Council, Secretary-General, Assistant Secretaries, directors, and technical staff of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>.
11. Chairman, Vice-Chairman, Undersecretaries, directors, and technical staff of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig>.
12. State representatives on the boards of directors of companies in which the State <orig>الدولة</orig> or one of the government entities, public authorities, or institutions, or other public legal persons, directly contributes no less than 25% of the capital.
13. Members of the boards of directors of cooperative societies <orig>الجمعيات التعاونية</orig>, their financial and administrative controllers, and sports authorities and clubs.
14. Chairmen of boards of directors and members of charitable and civil societies <orig>الجمعيات الخيرية والأهلية</orig>, and their executive directors.
15. Members of the Legal Department <orig>الإدارة القانونية</orig> in each of the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسات العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>, the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, and the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>.
16. Director, Deputy Directors, technical inspectors, members of the Legal Department <orig>الإدارة القانونية</orig>, and anyone with judicial enforcement authority <orig>صفة الضبطية القضائية</orig> in the General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>.

### Article (5) Clause (2):
Detection, monitoring, and tracking of corruption crimes, controlling acts, incidents, and violations of financial and administrative corruption, receiving reports, complaints, and information about corruption crimes and acts, incidents, and violations of financial and administrative corruption, taking necessary measures to investigate them, conducting preliminary inquiries, hearing statements regarding them, studying them, and taking legally required actions to either close the case or refer it to the competent investigative authority.

### Article (6)
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall have a Board of Directors consisting of five full-time members, whose appointment shall be by a decree based on the nomination of the competent Minister for a renewable term of four years, renewable once. The decree shall designate the Chairman and his deputy from among them. Members must possess integrity, experience, and competence in fields related to the Authority's work.
If the position of the Chairman, his deputy, or any of the Council members becomes vacant for any reason, a replacement shall be appointed using the same appointment procedures, and the new member shall complete only the term of his predecessor.

### Article (9)
If the Chairman, Vice-Chairman, or any of the Council members commits a serious breach of his duties, the competent Minister – after the approval of the Supreme Judicial Council <orig>المجلس الأعلى للقضاء</orig> – shall issue a decision to form a judicial committee of three advisors from the Court of Cassation <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig> or the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig>, chaired by the most senior among them, to investigate the breach. The committee shall submit a reasoned report on its work to the competent Minister within two months, concluding with either the termination of the membership of the investigated person or the closure of the case.

### Article (14)
The Chairman shall issue a decision specifying the authorized employees who are responsible for detecting and monitoring corruption crimes, controlling incidents, acts, and violations of financial and administrative corruption, conducting preliminary inquiries, collecting statements, gathering evidence and information, obtaining relevant papers and documents, and preparing the necessary reports in accordance with the provisions of this Law, in preparation for referring them to the competent investigative authority. This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

### Article (32) Clause (2):
(2) Update the declaration within sixty days from the end of every four years, as long as one remains in any of the positions subject to the provisions of this Chapter.

### Article (45) First Paragraph:
Anyone who violates the provisions of Articles (15, 16, 29, 34, 42) repeated of this Law shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not exceeding three years and a fine of not less than two thousand Dinars <orig>دينار</orig> and not exceeding ten thousand Dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties.

## (Article Two)
A new clause numbered (13) shall be added to Article (22), and a final paragraph to Article (27) of the aforementioned Law No. (2) of 2016. Furthermore, new articles shall be added to this Law, numbered (9 bis, 29 bis, 29 bis (a), 32 bis, 34 bis, 41 bis, 46 bis, 56 bis), with their texts as follows:

### Article (22), Clause (13):
13- Crimes stipulated in Decree-Law No. (24) of 1979 regarding Cooperative Societies <orig>الجمعيات التعاونية</orig>.

### Article (27), Second Paragraph:
Without prejudice to the provisions of Article (9) of the aforementioned Law of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig>, the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> may undertake the necessary investigative actions and hear statements to ascertain the seriousness of reports received or financial and administrative corruption facts it uncovers, in preparation for taking the appropriate decision regarding their disposition, whether by archiving them or referring them to the competent investigative authority.

### Article (9 bis):
The Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> alone shall be competent to investigate, dispose of, and prosecute crimes committed by the Chairman and members of the Council <orig>المجلس</orig> or any of the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> employees due to or in connection with the performance of their duties, provided that the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> shall notify the Council <orig>المجلس</orig> in advance of the investigation dates and the measures it has taken regarding the person under investigation.

### Article (29 bis):
The Council <orig>المجلس</orig> shall issue a reasoned decision by a majority of its members to archive the report submitted to the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> if it becomes clear that the conditions for its submission have not been met; otherwise, it shall refer it to the competent investigative authority.
The decision to archive shall not be invoked as an argument against that authority regarding any investigative procedures it deems appropriate to take.

### Article (29 bis (a)):
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> has the right to appeal decisions issued by the competent investigative authorities to archive reports referred by it, in accordance with the legally prescribed deadlines and procedures.

### Article (32 bis):
Subject to the provisions of the aforementioned Law No. (20) of 2014, the subject person <orig>الخاضع</orig> may submit their financial disclosure statement <orig>إقرار ذمته المالية</orig> and any other documents requested by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> in the form of an electronic document accompanied by their approved electronic signature, using any modern electronic communication means capable of storage and retrieval, in accordance with the rules and controls specified by the executive regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of this Law.

### Article (34 bis):
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, after obtaining permission from the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig>, may assign any person – even if not subject to the provisions of this Law – to submit a financial disclosure statement <orig>إقرار بذمته المالية</orig> whenever there is evidence that they have gained a new benefit from a corruption crime. The person shall be obliged to submit the required statement within ninety days of being assigned to do so.

### Article (41 bis):
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> is prohibited from disclosing the identity and data of the whistleblower <orig>المبلغ</orig> unless judicial procedures require otherwise, or based on prior written consent from the whistleblower <orig>المبلغ</orig>.

### Article (46 bis):
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> may reconcile in crimes related to the delay in submitting the financial disclosure statement <orig>إقرار الذمة المالية</orig> if the required statement is submitted within ninety days following the expiry of the period necessary for its submission or following its warning, as the case may be.
Reconciliation shall be in exchange for payment of an amount of 100 Dinars <orig>دينار</orig>.
Reconciliation shall result in the non-initiation of criminal proceedings.

### Article (56 bis):
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall follow any of the following methods for serving documents related to the application of the provisions of this Law and its executive regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig>:
1. The method of serving judicial documents by electronic notification or by process servers.
2. A letter accompanied by an acknowledgment of receipt via mail or delivery by a person authorized by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>.
3. Any means consistent with the provisions of applicable laws.

## (Article Three)
The word (Council <orig>المجلس</orig>) shall be replaced by the phrase (Board of Trustees <orig>مجلس الأمناء</orig>), and the word (Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig>) shall be replaced by the phrases (Head of the Authority <orig>رئيس الهيئة</orig>, and Chairman of the Board of Trustees <orig>رئيس مجلس الأمناء</orig>) wherever they appear in the texts of the articles of the aforementioned Law No. (2) of 2016.

## (Article Four)
Any provision that contradicts the provisions of this Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بقانون</orig> shall be repealed.

## (Article Five)
Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بقانون</orig>, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and come into effect from the date of its publication.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
**Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**
Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>

# Decree-Law No. 70 of 2025
## Repealing the Text of Articles (159 and 182)
## of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> Issued
## by Law No. 16 of 1960

- Having reviewed the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to
10 May 2024 AD,
- And the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. 16 of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig> and its amending decrees,
- And based on the presentation of the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بقانون</orig>:
( Article One )
The text of Articles (159 and 182) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> shall be repealed.

# Explanatory Memorandum
## For Decree-Law No. 69 of 2025
## Amending Certain Provisions of Law No. 2 of 2016
## Regarding the Establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>
## And Provisions Related to Financial Disclosure

In the framework of enhancing the system of transparency and integrity and supporting national efforts aimed
at combating corruption, this Decree-Law was issued as an amendment to certain provisions of Law
No. (2) of 2016 regarding the establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>
and provisions related to financial disclosure, to address gaps arising from
the practical application of its provisions and to align with new developments.
The Decree has included new categories under the umbrella of the Law's provisions, which enhances
the comprehensiveness of anti-corruption efforts, in addition to including crimes stipulated
in Decree-Law No. (24) of 1979 regarding Cooperative Societies <orig>الجمعيات التعاونية</orig>
among corruption crimes.
It was deemed appropriate in this Decree to establish a new formation for the Council and name it the Board
of Directors of the Authority, consisting of five members, including the Chairman, his Deputy, and three
full-time members.
"This Decree has entrusted the Board of Directors of the Authority with the jurisdiction to dismiss complaints
submitted to the Authority if it is found that they do not meet the submission conditions, by a reasoned decision
by a majority of members, while emphasizing the Authority's right to appeal decisions of the investigating body
to dismiss complaints."
It was also deemed appropriate to stipulate that the identity and data of
the informant shall not be disclosed except to the competent investigative authorities upon their request, or upon the written approval of
the Authority, along with the introduction of a provision allowing the Authority to accept financial disclosure statements
submitted in the form of an electronic document.
In order to provide the necessary guarantees for the Authority's employees, the Decree has granted
the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> exclusive jurisdiction to investigate, dispose of, and prosecute incidents
committed by the Authority's employees during or due to the performance of their duties, while ensuring
that the Authority's Board of Directors is notified of investigation dates and measures taken.
This Decree has introduced the possibility of accepting reconciliation in crimes of delay in
submitting financial disclosure statements, provided that the person subject to the provisions of this Law initiates the submission
of the statement within the specified period and pays the determined amount, which achieves flexibility without prejudice
to the principles of justice.
<page_end>5</page_end>

that targets the life of a child contradicts constitutional principles and international obligations as previously stated.
And based on the same established constitutional principles guaranteed by the Constitution of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in protecting rights and freedoms, ensuring justice and equality among members of society, and in implementation of the international obligations adopted by the State through its ratification of conventions concerned with combating violence against women, it has become
Explanatory Memorandum <orig>المذكرة الإيضاحية</orig>
for Decree-Law No. 70 of 2025 <orig>المرسوم بقانون رقم 70 لسنة 2025</orig>
Regarding the Repeal of the Text of Articles (159 and 182)
of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> Issued by Law No. 16 of 1960 <orig>القانون رقم 16 لسنة 1960</orig>
Based on the established constitutional principles guaranteed by the Constitution of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in protecting motherhood and childhood, caring for the youth and protecting them from exploitation and neglect, and in implementation of the international obligations adopted by the State through its ratification of charters and conventions concerned with children's rights, it has become necessary to repeal the text of Article (159) of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. (16) of 1960 <orig>القانون رقم (16) لسنة 1960</orig> regarding what this text stipulated as a mitigating legal excuse for a mother who kills her newborn immediately after birth to avoid shame.
The necessity of this repeal is based on several justifications, including those related to the conflict of the aforementioned Article (159) with the principles established by the Constitution of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, especially what Article (9) thereof stipulated: (The family is the foundation of society, its pillars are religion, morals, and love of the homeland; the law preserves its entity, strengthens its bonds, and protects motherhood and childhood under its ظل), and what Article (10) of the Constitution stipulated: (The State is committed to caring for the youth and protecting them from exploitation, and safeguarding them from moral, physical, and spiritual neglect), given that the right to life is the basis of all other rights that are linked to it in existence and non-existence, a principle affirmed by Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig> in the words of Allah Almighty in verses (8, 9) of Surat At-Takwir <orig>سورة التكوير</orig> (And when the girl buried alive is asked, for what sin she was killed), and His saying, Glorified and Exalted be He, in verse (31) of Surat Al-Isra <orig>سورة الإسراء</orig> (And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you).
In addition to other considerations related to the undermining of the aforementioned Article (159) of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> with the international obligations of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> under the Convention on the Rights of the Child of 1989, which the State ratified by Law No. (104) of 1991 <orig>القانون رقم (104) لسنة 1991</orig>, especially what this Convention stipulated in its Article Six: (States Parties recognize that every child has the inherent right to life) and States Parties shall ensure to the maximum extent possible the survival and development of the child, and what was stated in the Arab Children's Rights Charter of 1983 <orig>ميثاق حقوق الطفل العربي لعام 1983</orig> which the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> approved by Law No. (36) of 1993 <orig>القانون رقم (36) لسنة 1993</orig>, and which emphasized the necessity of providing the highest degree of legal protection for children from all forms of violence and neglect.
For all these reasons, it has become clear that the continued application of Article (159) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>, by allowing an unjustified exception in mitigating punishment for crimes
also necessary, and it is imperative to repeal the text of Article (182) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>, which stipulated the exemption of a kidnapper from punishment if he marries the person he kidnapped, due to the explicit contradiction of the provisions of this article with the provisions of the Constitution, established legal principles, and relevant international conventions.
This contradiction is represented by the conflict of Article (182) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> with Article (29) of the Constitution, which states that (People are equal in human dignity, and they are equal before the law in public rights and duties, with no discrimination among them in this regard due to gender, origin, language, or religion), as the aforementioned Article (182) permits an unjustified advantage for the perpetrator to escape punishment merely by marrying the victim, which creates legal discrimination that harms women's rights and undermines the principle of equality before the law.
Furthermore, it thus constitutes a blatant violation of the victim's rights and perpetuates a culture of impunity, which necessitates its repeal to ensure the alignment of national legislation with constitutional values and criminal justice, as it has become clear that its continued application provides an unjustified legal cover for perpetrators.
And since the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> was issued on 10/5/2024, and Article (4) thereof stipulated that laws shall be issued by decree-laws, therefore, the draft of the similar Decree-Law <orig>المرسوم بقانون</orig> was prepared, and its first article stipulated the repeal of the text of Articles (159 and 182) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>. The second article of the similar draft obligated the ministers, each within their respective jurisdiction, to implement this law. It also specified its effective date as of the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
<page_end>6</page_end>

### Article Two

The Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig> shall implement this Decree, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>
Abdullah Ali Abdullah Al-Salem Al-Sabah <orig>عبد الله علي عبد الله السالم الصباح</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 20 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 18 May 2025 AD

# Constitutional Court <orig>الحكمة الدستورية</orig>
## Consultation Chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig>

At the session held by the Court in the Consultation Chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig> on 16 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH corresponding to 14 May 2025 AD
Presided over by His Excellency Counselor <orig>المستشار</orig> / Adel Ali Al-Bahwa <orig>عادل علي البحوه</orig>, President of the Court <orig>رئيس الحكمة</orig>
And with the membership of Their Excellencies Counselors <orig>المستشارين</orig> /
Saleh Khalifa Al-Murshed <orig>صالح خليفه المرشد</orig> and Abdul Rahman Mishari Al-Darmi <orig>عبد الرحمن مشاري الدارمي</orig>
And Ibrahim Abdul Rahman Al-Saif <orig>إبراهيم عبد الرحمن السيف</orig> and Waleed Ibrahim Al-Moajel <orig>وليد إبراهيم المعجل</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. / Yousef Ahmed Ma'rafi <orig>يوسف أحمد معرفي</orig>, Session Secretary <orig>أمين سر الجلسة</orig>
The following decision was issued:
In the Direct Appeal / Consultation Chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig>
Registered in the Court's <orig>الحكمة</orig> register under number (1) for the year 2025
Filed by: Yaqoub Yousef Ali Al-Muzaini <orig>يعقوب يوسف علي المزيني</orig>
The Court <orig>الحكمة</orig>
After reviewing the documents and deliberation.
Whereas the appellant <orig>الطاعن</orig> challenged the unconstitutionality of the second paragraph of Article (14) of Law No. (1) of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds <orig>حماية الأموال العامة</orig>, which punishes a public employee <orig>الموظف العام</orig> if, by their error, they cause serious harm to the funds or interests of the entity they work for or are connected with by virtue of their position, and if the serious error they committed resulted in damage to the country's financial, commercial, or economic conditions, or to any national interest thereof, the appellant <orig>الطاعن</orig> argued that this text violated the principle of legality of crime and punishment <orig>شرعية الجريمة والعقوبة</orig> as its phrases were undefined and unclear, capable of bearing more than one meaning, which could lead to multiple interpretations regarding the concept and limits of serious error <orig>الخطأ الجسيم</orig> and serious harm <orig>الضرر الجسيم</orig>, thus constituting a violation of personal liberty <orig>الحرية الشخصية</orig> guaranteed by Article (30) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>.
The appellant <orig>الطاعن</orig> also challenged the unconstitutionality of the first paragraph of Article (20) of the same Law, which did not permit the application of Article (81) in any case to any of the crimes mentioned in this Law unless the perpetrator <orig>الجاني</orig> promptly returned the full funds subject of the crime before the closure of pleadings <orig>إقفال باب المرافعة</orig> in cases where restitution is mandatory. This, it was argued, established an unjustified discrimination between perpetrators of intentional crimes against public funds <orig>المال العام</orig> who are obliged to make restitution, thus allowing Article (81) to be applied to them, and perpetrators of such crimes by error, for whom the application of that Article is prohibited due to their lack of obligation to make restitution, in violation of the principles of justice <orig>العدالة</orig>, equality <orig>المساواة</orig>, and equal opportunities <orig>تكافؤ الفرص</orig>, in addition to violating the standards of a fair and equitable trial <orig>المحاكمة العادلة المنصفة</orig>, as stipulated in Articles (7), (8), (29), (34), and (163) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>.
The appellant <orig>الطاعن</orig> further challenged Article (21 bis) <orig>21 مكرراً</orig> of the same Law, which stipulated that criminal proceedings <orig>الدعوى الجزائية</orig> for crimes stipulated in this Law shall not lapse by prescription <orig>بمضي المدة</orig>. This deprived perpetrators of unintentional serious error crimes <orig>جرائم الخطأ الجسيم غير العمدي</orig> from the prescription of their criminal actions, despite the fact that both intentional and unintentional crimes in all laws are subject to the period of prescription stipulated in the law, which violates the principle of equality <orig>المساواة</orig> stipulated in Article (29) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>.
<page_end>8</page_end>

  "page_summary": "This page details a court's decision to reject an appeal, explaining that the appellant lacks direct personal interest in challenging the constitutionality of certain legal texts, as the prior conviction and its consequences remain unaffected, and the appeal does not offer a direct benefit."
}

<header>
9
Sunday, 27 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH - 25/5/2025 AD
Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1740, Seventy-First Year
</header>
The appellant added that he had a direct personal interest in filing his present appeal due to the issuance of a final criminal judgment convicting him under the aforementioned challenged provisions, despite their unconstitutionality. This resulted in damages, represented by a claim for compensation from the administrative authority for which he worked, under Case No. (8027) of 2019, Civil Plenary, Government/14, and its appeal No. (3913) of 2023, Commercial Civil, Government/10. A judgment was issued in that case obligating him to pay substantial financial amounts by way of compensation. The cassation appeal against that judgment, No. (1268) of 2024, Civil, has not yet been decided to date. A ruling on the unconstitutionality of those articles would render them null and void, making them unsuitable as a basis for claiming compensation. Furthermore, the conviction judgment resulted in his deprivation from working in his financial specialization, which affects his career future.

Given this, and as stipulated by Article (4 bis) – added by Law No. (109) of 2014 to Law No. (14) of 1973 establishing the Constitutional Court – although the legislator permitted any natural or legal person to file a direct appeal before this Court – against any law, decree-law, or regulation – the legislator explicitly required in the text of this article that the appellant must have a direct personal interest, without which the appeal is inadmissible. This means that the legislative text alleged to violate the Constitution must have caused harm to the appellant as a result of its application to him, or that the probability of harm to him is high, such that a ruling on its unconstitutionality would remove this harm and achieve a benefit for him. The legislator also required that the appeal be serious as an indispensable condition for its admissibility, and this Court has the authority to investigate this matter. If it finds the appeal to be not serious, it shall decide – in the consultation chamber – its inadmissibility.

In light of the foregoing, and as this Court had previously concluded in its decision issued by the consultation chamber on 10/7/2024 in Direct Appeal No. (5) of 2024 – filed by the same appellant – that the phrasing of the second paragraph of the challenged Article (14) was "clear and explicit, without ambiguity or obscurity, as it speaks of the forms of error claimed, the damages that may befall the employer due to it, and the penalty prescribed for these acts. It does not fault the text to leave it to the judge to assess the gravity of this error or the resulting damages in light of the material facts presented before him, thus the text would not have violated the aforementioned articles of the Constitution." The Court also affirmed in the same decision that the text of the first paragraph of Article (20) of the Law does not achieve a substantial interest for the appellant that would permit him to file his appeal against it, as this relates to the imposed penalty and the judge's authority to decide to refrain from pronouncing punishment. It has been established that the matter of the accusation attributed to the appellant was settled due to his error in causing severe damage to the funds of the entity he works for, and he was convicted by a final judgment that cannot be reviewed or commented upon. Therefore, a ruling on the unconstitutionality of that text – assuming the validity of the appellant's claim regarding preventing the judge from exercising his discretionary power to decide to refrain from pronouncing punishment – will not have an effect on the judgment issued for his conviction, as long as it does not affect the removal of the text of criminalization itself. Consequently, it will not result in his retrial for the same act again, as he remains responsible for the committed error and for compensating the damages incurred by his employer due to it. Thus, he does not have a direct personal interest in the appeal. Since the appellant in the present appeal reiterated the same appeal against the text of the two aforementioned articles, the basis for accepting his appeal is lacking. Nor will it benefit him thereafter to add the appeal against Article (21 bis) of the Law, which stipulated that criminal proceedings for crimes stipulated in this law do not lapse by prescription, as it is inconceivable to consider the prescription of criminal proceedings after a final judgment of conviction has been issued and that judgment has been executed. Furthermore, this prescription has no relation to the compensation claim filed by his employer to demand compensation for the damages he caused, which relies on the provisions of tort liability. Therefore, he also does not have a direct personal interest in appealing this article. Nor does the argument that he still suffers from the moral and psychological effects of the conviction judgment change this, as a legally recognized interest cannot be merely a theoretical interest whose sole purpose is the abstract annulment of the challenged provisions; rather, the appellant must derive a direct benefit from requesting their annulment. This makes it appropriate to rule on the inadmissibility of the appeal and confiscate the bond.

Therefore,
The Court – in the consultation chamber – decided to dismiss the appeal and confiscate the bond.

</header>
# Consultation Chamber

At the session held by the Court in the Consultation Chamber on 16 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH, corresponding to 14 May 2025 AD
Presided over by His Excellency Counselor / Adel Ali Al-Jahwa <orig>عادل علي الجحوه</orig>, President of the Court
And with the membership of Their Excellencies Counselors /
Saleh Khalifa Al-Murshid <orig>صالح خليفه المرشد</orig> and Abdul Rahman Mishari Al-Darmi <orig>عبد الرحمن مشاري الدارمي</orig>
and Ibrahim Abdul Rahman Al-Saif <orig>إبراهيم عبد الرحمن السيف</orig> and Waleed Ibrahim Al-Moajel <orig>وليد إبراهيم المعجل</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. / Yousef Ahmed Ma'rafi <orig>يوسف أحمد معرفي</orig>, Session Secretary

The following decision was issued:
In the Direct Appeal / Consultation Chamber
Registered in the Court's register under No. (2) for the year 2025
Filed by: GS Engineering and Construction Company <orig>شركة جي اس للهندسة والإنشاءات</orig>
The Court

After reviewing the documents and deliberation.
Whereas the appellant company challenged the unconstitutionality of Clause (First / B) of Executive Rule No. (28) of the Executive Rules and Instructions for Kuwaiti Income Tax Decree No. (3) of 1955, as amended by Law No. (2) of 2008, issued by Administrative Decision of the Assistant Undersecretary for Financial and Tax Affairs No. (875) of 2013, regarding its stipulation that the costs and expenses of subcontractor works must not exceed the revenues of these works for them to be deductible from taxable income. This is in violation of Article (3) of the Income Tax Decree, which mandated the deduction of all expenses and costs incurred to generate taxable income, and Article (3) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (2) of 2008, which specified the conditions for allowable expenses and costs deductible from taxable income, limiting these conditions to being necessary to generate income from the activity, being genuine and supported by documents, and relating to the taxable period. Thus, the challenged text has added a condition not found in the law or its executive regulations, which renders it unconstitutional for violating the principle of separation of powers, the principle that no tax may be created or amended except by law, and the principle that laws and regulations may not be applied retroactively, as stipulated in Articles (50), (51), (72), (73), (134), and (179) of the Constitution, in addition to the illegitimacy of that text for violating an effective and applicable legal provision. The appellant had a direct personal interest in filing this similar appeal, as tax was assessed against it for the financial years ending on 31/12/2013 and 31/12/2014, and the deduction of costs and expenses of subcontractor works from taxable income was disallowed in accordance with the aforementioned executive rule. Consequently, it appealed the tax assessment, and the dispute between it and the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> in this regard is still pending before the judiciary, which prompted it to file this similar appeal.

It was established, in accordance with Article (Fourth bis) – added by virtue of Law No. (109) of 2014 to the Law Establishing the Constitutional Court No. (14) of 1973 – that while the legislator permitted any natural or legal person to file a direct appeal before this Court against any law, decree-law, or its regulations, the legislator explicitly required in the text of this article that the appeal must be serious as an indispensable condition for its admissibility. This Court shall investigate this matter, and if it finds that the appeal is not serious or falls outside its jurisdiction, it shall decide – in the Consultation Chamber – its inadmissibility.

Given this, and since the grounds of appeal primarily focused on the challenged text from the Executive Rules and Instructions for Kuwaiti Income Tax Decree violating the law under which it was issued, due to the law not including the conditions it stipulated for deducting expenses and costs related to subcontractor works from taxable income, and given that the aforementioned text did not involve the creation of a new tax or its amendment, and as the jurisprudence of this Court has settled that the judicial review it exercises regarding the constitutionality of regulations is based on a conflict between a provision therein and a provision in the Constitution, then if the challenged decision suffers from a defect of violating the law, this defect is considered related to its legality, sufficient alone to request its annulment before the Administrative Circuit, which has become solely competent to annul administrative decisions violating laws since the issuance of Decree-Law No. (20) of 1981 establishing a circuit within the General Court to hear administrative disputes, amended by Law No. (61) of 1982. This is because the Administrative Circuit must, before applying any regulatory provision, ascertain its legality and conformity with the law. Therefore, the challenged text falls outside the scope of judicial review exercised by the Constitutional Court, and it is appropriate to rule the appeal inadmissible and confiscate the bond.

Therefore,
The Court <orig>المحكمة</orig> – in the Consultation Chamber – decided to declare the appeal inadmissible and confiscate the bond.

Session Secretary President of the Court
# Consultation Chamber

At the session held by the Court in the Consultation Chamber on 16 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH, corresponding to 14 May 2025 AD
Presided over by His Excellency Counselor / Adel Ali Al-Juhah <orig>عادل علي الجوهه</orig>, President of the Court
And with the membership of Their Excellencies Counselors /
Saleh Khalifa Al-Huraishid <orig>صالح خليفه الحريشد</orig> and Abdul Rahman Mishari Al-Darmi <orig>عبد الرحمن مشاري الدارمي</orig> and Ibrahim Abdul Rahman Al-Saif <orig>إبراهيم عبد الرحمن السيف</orig> and Waleed Ibrahim Al-Moajel <orig>وليد إبراهيم المعجل</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. / Yousef Ahmed Ma'rafi <orig>يوسف أحمد معرفي</orig>, Session Secretary

The following decision was issued:
In the Direct Appeal / Consultation Chamber
Registered in the Court's register under No. (3) for the year 2025
Filed by: Inverted House Coffee Shop Company for Beverages <orig>شركة كوفي شوب البيت المقلوب لتقديم المشروبات</orig> to the Court

After reviewing the documents and deliberation.

}

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1740, Seventy-First Year
11
Sunday, 27 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH - 25/5/2025 AD
</header>

Whereas the appellant company challenged the unconstitutionality of the Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig> Resolution No. (227) of 2024 concerning the amendment of Resolution No. (27) of 2015 issuing the Executive Regulations of Law No. (39) of 2014 concerning Consumer Protection <orig>حماية المستهلك</orig>, specifically regarding the addition of Article (40 bis) to the Regulations, which permitted the Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وكيل وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> to issue a decision granting exclusive and comprehensive licenses to companies or institutions approved by the competent official authorities, to undertake the organization of major national events and celebrations. The appellant argued that this article contained provisions not included in Law No. (39) of 2014 concerning Consumer Protection <orig>حماية المستهلك</orig>, and were not necessary for its implementation, and amounted to an amendment of its provisions, as the Law regulated how to obtain a license to conduct temporary discounts or special offers on prices of goods displayed to the public without differentiation among those addressed by its provisions, whereas the challenged Ministerial Resolution allowed the granting of exclusive licenses to specific companies to the exclusion of others, in violation of the provisions of this Law. It also violated Articles (7) and (8) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig> as it restricted the organization and conduct of special offers and discounts to the company exclusively licensed for that purpose, and compelled all other companies to submit to it and join it in this matter, which contradicts the principles of equality and equal opportunities. The appellant had a direct personal interest in filing the present appeal, as, based on the challenged Resolution, the Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وكيل وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> issued a decision granting one of the companies licensed by the Ministry an exclusive license to organize the Kuwait Shopping Festival <orig>مهرجان الكويت للتسوق</orig> in 2025, thereby depriving the appellant of the opportunity to apply for such a license, which prompted it to file the present appeal.
It was established, in accordance with Article (4 bis) – added by virtue of Law No. (109) of 2014 to the Law establishing the Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig> No. (14) of 1973 – that the legislator, while permitting any natural or legal person to file a direct claim before this Court challenging any law, decree-law, or regulation, explicitly stipulated in this article that the appeal must be serious as an indispensable condition for its acceptance. This Court may investigate this matter, and if it finds that the appeal is not serious or falls outside its jurisdiction, it shall decide – in chambers – to dismiss it.
Given this, and as the jurisprudence of this Court has settled that equality before the law is achieved by the fulfillment of the conditions of generality and abstraction in the legal rule, and it is clear that the challenged Resolution permitted the granting of exclusive and comprehensive licenses to companies or institutions approved by the competent official authorities, to undertake the organization of major national events and celebrations, by virtue of a general, abstract rule applicable to all those addressed by its provisions without any differentiation or discrimination among them, therefore, the claim of its violation of the principle of equality and equal opportunities is unfounded, and the matter in this regard reverts to how companies are selected for such licensing, which is a matter related to the application of the text and thus falls outside the scope of this Court's oversight.
As for the argument that the challenged Resolution violates the law under which it was issued for implementation, the jurisprudence of this Court has settled that the judicial oversight it exercises regarding the constitutionality of regulations is based on the existence of a conflict between a provision therein and a provision in the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>. If the challenged Resolution suffers from a defect of violating the law, then this defect is considered related to its legality, sufficient alone to request its annulment before the Administrative Circuit <orig>الدائرة الإدارية</orig>, which has become solely competent to annul administrative decisions that violate laws since the issuance of Decree-Law No. (20) of 1981 establishing a circuit within the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> to hear administrative disputes, amended by Law No. (61) of 1982, as the Administrative Circuit <orig>الدائرة الإدارية</orig> must, before applying any regulatory text, verify its legality and conformity with the law. Consequently, the challenged Resolution falls outside the scope of judicial oversight exercised by the Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig>, and it is appropriate to rule the appeal inadmissible and confiscate the guarantee.

Therefore,
The Court – in chambers – decided to dismiss the appeal and confiscate the guarantee.

  "page_summary": "This page contains a decision from the Consultation Chamber of the Kuwaiti Constitutional Court, dated May 14, 2025, regarding the inadmissibility of a direct appeal challenging the constitutionality of Article 3 of Law No. 88 of 1995 concerning the trial of ministers, due to lack of seriousness in the appeal."
}
</page_metadata>
<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1740, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 27 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH - 25/5/2025 AD
12
</header>

Whereas the appellant challenged the constitutionality of Article (3) of Law No. (88) of 1995 <orig>القانون رقم (88) لسنة 1995 في شأن محاكمة الوزراء</orig> concerning the Trial of Ministers, insofar as it provides for the formation of an investigation committee <orig>لجنة تحقيق</orig> composed of three Kuwaiti counselors <orig>المستشارين الكويتيين</orig> from the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig> specializing in examining submitted complaints and possessing all powers legally assigned to investigative authorities, due to its violation of Article (167) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>, which stipulates that the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> shall undertake public prosecution <orig>الدعوى العمومية</orig> on behalf of society, and only exempts security authorities <orig>جهات الأمن</orig> from undertaking public prosecution in misdemeanors <orig>الجنح</orig> in accordance with the procedures specified by law. The appellant had a direct personal interest in submitting the present appeal, as on 5/8/2024, a decision was issued by the aforementioned committee to seize all his cash, movable assets, and real estate, and to prohibit him from disposing of them, in connection with the investigation into Case No. (2) of 2024 <orig>القضية رقم (2) لسنة 2024 حصر تحقيق وزراء</orig> (Ministers' Investigation Inventory), despite him not being investigated or charged with any offense therein, which prompted him to submit the present appeal.
It was established, in accordance with Article (4 bis) <orig>المادة (الرابعة مكرراً)</orig> – added by virtue of Law No. (109) of 2014 <orig>القانون رقم (109) لسنة 2014</orig> to the Law Establishing the Constitutional Court <orig>قانون إنشاء المحكمة الدستورية</orig> No. (14) of 1973 <orig>القانون رقم (14) لسنة 1973</orig> – that although the legislator permitted any natural or legal person to file a direct appeal <orig>طعناً بطريق الادعاء المباشر</orig> before this Court against any law, decree-law, or regulation, the legislator explicitly required, by virtue of this article, that the appeal must be serious <orig>الجدية في الطعن</orig> as an indispensable condition for its acceptance, and this Court has the discretion to investigate this matter. If it deems the appeal not serious, it shall decide – in the consultation chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig> – its non-acceptance.
Given the foregoing, and since Article (132) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig> entrusted the legislator with issuing a special law defining crimes committed by ministers in the performance of their duties, and outlining the procedures for their accusation, trial, and the manner of such trial. In response to this constitutional directive, the legislator issued Law No. (88) of 1995 <orig>القانون رقم (88) لسنة 1995 في شأن محاكمة الوزراء</orig> concerning the Trial of Ministers, which specified the body competent to try ministers as a special court <orig>محكمة خاصة</orig> composed of five Kuwaiti counselors <orig>المستشارين الكويتيين</orig> from the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig>. And due to the specificity and importance of the crimes falling within the jurisdiction of that court, the legislator deemed it appropriate – by virtue of the text of Article (3) of the aforementioned and challenged law – that a special investigation committee <orig>لجنة تحقيق خاصة</orig> composed of three Kuwaiti counselors <orig>المستشارين الكويتيين</orig> from the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig> should undertake the preliminary inquiries <orig>أعمال الاستدلال</orig> and investigation <orig>التحقيق</orig> in such cases, in compliance with what is stated in the aforementioned Article (132) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>, which authorized the legislator to determine the accusation procedures <orig>إجراءات الاتهام</orig> for those crimes. Thus, this committee was entrusted with the task of examining complaints submitted in this regard and taking any action required by such examination, and it shall have all powers legally assigned to investigative authorities. The law did not overlook the role of the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> in public prosecution <orig>الدعوى العمومية</orig>, as it mandated the attendance of a Public Prosecution member, whose rank is not less than that of a Chief Prosecutor <orig>رئيس نيابة</orig>, at investigation sessions and to express any requests they deem appropriate. It also stipulated that the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> is the body that undertakes the task of prosecution <orig>الادعاء</orig> before the Court. Therefore, the claim of unconstitutionality of the challenged text for violating Article (167) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig> is unfounded, which means that the present appeal lacks seriousness, and thus it is appropriate to rule for its non-acceptance and the confiscation of the bail.
Therefore,
The Court – in the consultation chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig> – decided to reject the appeal and confiscate the bail.
<footer>
Secretary
President of the Court
</footer>

## Ministerial Resolution No. (59) of 2025 AD
### Regarding the Amendment of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of the Kuwaiti Lawyers Association <orig>جمعية المحامين الكويتية</orig>
Minister of Social Affairs <orig>وزير الشئون الاجتماعية</orig> and Family and Childhood Affairs <orig>شئون الأسرة والطفولة</orig>.
*   Having reviewed Law No. (24) of (1962) concerning Clubs and Public Benefit Associations <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig> and its amendments.
*   And Decree No. (50) of (2017) concerning the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>.
*   And Ministerial Resolution No. (61) of (2005) regarding the Model Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي النموذجي</orig> for Public Benefit Associations <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig>.
*   And Ministerial Resolution No. (1/8) of (1962) regarding the declaration of the Kuwaiti Lawyers Association <orig>جمعية المحامين الكويتية</orig>.
*   And the minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig> meeting held on 2025/3/9 to amend the Association's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> in accordance with the model.
*   And the approval of the Committee for the Declaration, Evaluation, and Dissolution of Public Benefit Associations <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig> and Charities <orig>المبرات</orig>, and the Study and Review of their Articles of Association <orig>أنظمتها الأساسية</orig> at its meeting No. (21/2024) held on (2024/10/16 AD).
*   And the memorandum of the Assistant Undersecretary for Social Development <orig>الوكيل المساعد للتنمية الاجتماعية</orig> dated (2025/3/19 AD).
*   And after the presentation by the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>.
*   And based on the requirements of the public interest.
((Decided))

### Article (1):
Amendment of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of the Kuwaiti Lawyers Association <orig>جمعية المحامين الكويتية</orig> in accordance with the Model Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي النموذجي</orig>.

### Article (2):

Amendment of Article (36) to read as follows: (The affairs of the Association shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> consisting of eleven members elected by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig>).

### Article (5):
The provisions of this resolution shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and the competent authorities <orig>جهات الاختصاص</orig> shall be informed and implement its contents.

# Resolution No. (86) of 2025
## Regarding the Appointment of a Temporary Board of Directors for the Women's Voluntary Association for Community Development / Al-Jam'iya Al-Tatawou'iya Al-Nisa'iya Lil-Tanmiya Al-Mujtama'iya <orig>الجمعية التطوعية النسائية للتنمية المجتمعية</orig>

Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs / Wazir Al-Shu'un Al-Ijtima'iya wa Shu'un Al-Usra wal-Tufoola <orig>وزير الشئون الاجتماعية وشئون الأسرة والطفولة</orig>
*   After reviewing Law No. 24 of 1962 concerning Clubs and Public Benefit Associations / Jam'iyat Al-Naf' Al-'Am <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig> and its amending laws.
*   And upon Decree No. (50) of 2017 concerning the Ministry of Social Affairs / Wizarat Al-Shu'un Al-Ijtima'iya <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>.
*   And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (1056) of 1991 declaring the Women's Voluntary Association for Community Development / Al-Jam'iya Al-Tatawou'iya Al-Nisa'iya Lil-Tanmiya Al-Mujtama'iya <orig>الجمعية التطوعية النسائية للتنمية المجتمعية</orig>.
*   And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (61) of 2005 regarding the Model Articles of Association for Public Benefit Associations / Jam'iyat Al-Naf' Al-'Am <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig>.
*   And based on what the public interest dictates,
(( Has Decided ))

### Article (1):
The Board of Directors of the Women's Voluntary Association for Community Development / Al-Jam'iya Al-Tatawou'iya Al-Nisa'iya Lil-Tanmiya Al-Mujtama'iya <orig>الجمعية التطوعية النسائية للتنمية المجتمعية</orig> is dissolved, and a temporary Board of Directors for the Women's Voluntary Association for Community Development / Al-Jam'iya Al-Tatawou'iya Al-Nisa'iya Lil-Tanmiya Al-Mujtama'iya <orig>الجمعية التطوعية النسائية للتنمية المجتمعية</orig> is appointed for a renewable period of one year, chaired by Ms. Bashayer Salah Abdullah Ali Shaheen Al-Ghanim <orig>بشائر صلاح عبدالله علي شاهين الغانم</orig>, and with the membership of:
1.  Hawra Nader Abdullah Al-Habib <orig>حوراء نادر عبدالله الحبيب</orig>
2.  Falah Abdulaziz Mohammed Al-Shamali <orig>فله عبدالعزيز محمد الشمالي</orig>
3.  Abdulaziz Adel Al-Mana'i <orig>عبدالعزيز عادل المناعي</orig>
4.  Abdullah Yousef Al-Hajri <orig>عبدالله يوسف الهاجري</orig>

### Article (2):
The former Board of Directors of the Association shall hand over to the appointed Board of Directors the headquarters, funds, and all documents and papers related to the Association, by official minutes within three days from the date of issuance of this Resolution.

### Article (3):
The appointed Board of Directors shall assume all competencies and powers of the Board of Directors stipulated in the aforementioned Law No. (24) of 1962 and the Association's Articles of Association.

### Article (4):
The appointed Board of Directors shall examine the Association's budget, conduct a documentary review of the Association's books and records, verify the existence of any violations, and take necessary actions regarding them to ensure the preservation of the Association's funds.

### Article (5):
This Resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance.

# Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. (3) of 2025
### Regarding the Formation of a Committee to Manage the Affairs of a Trade Union Organization in the Absence of a Board of Directors

The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig> and Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>:

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (6) of 2010 concerning Labor in the Private Sector <orig>القطاع الأهلي</orig> and its amendments,
- Law No. (109) of 2013 concerning the Establishment of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>,
- Decree No. (153) of 2022 transferring supervision of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>,
- International conventions on freedom of association, particularly Convention No. (87) of 1948,
- The Regulation of Trade Union Work <orig>تنظيم العمل النقابي</orig> issued by Administrative Decision No. (1470) of 2015,
- What is required by the interest of work, public interest, and the stability of trade union organizations and employers' organizations,

We have decided:
Article (1):
The competent Minister <orig>الوزير المختص</orig> shall issue a decision to form a temporary committee to manage the affairs of the concerned organization until new elections are held in accordance with the provisions of the law and regulating regulations. This shall apply in cases where judicial rulings lead to the dissolution of the trade union organization's board of directors, either wholly or partially, or in the event of a dispute arising between employers' and workers' organizations, or within any of these organizations, or among them, or for any other reason that leads to the organization's inability to perform its duties or paralyzes its capacity to continue exercising its trade union activities.

Article (2):
The committee shall be formed from members of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig>. The committee may seek assistance from individuals with expertise and specialization in performing its tasks, without them having the right to vote.

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Resolution No. (95) of 2025
Regarding the renewal of a collective investment scheme license;

**Having reviewed:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments;
- The collective investment scheme license certificate for Baitak Capital Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال لأسواق النقد بالدينار الكويتي</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars, No. (LCIS/2019/0001), issued on 18/08/2022;
- The request from Baitak Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بيتك كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to renew the license for Baitak Capital Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال لأسواق النقد بالدينار الكويتي</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars;
- And based on Resolution No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**It has been decided as follows:**

### Article One:
The collective investment scheme license for Baitak Capital Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال لأسواق النقد بالدينار الكويتي</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars shall be renewed for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 18/08/2025.

### Article Two:
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

### Article (3):
The Temporary Committee <orig>اللجنة المؤقتة</orig> shall undertake the following tasks:
- Managing urgent administrative and financial matters of the organization to ensure its continued performance of its basic functions.
- Receiving prescribed subscriptions from the organization's members.
- Preparing and updating lists of the names of General Assembly members who meet the conditions for membership and voting rights.
- Issuing invitations for an electoral General Assembly meeting within the period specified for the committee's work.
- Supervising nomination procedures and election procedures in accordance with the provisions of the Labor Law <orig>قانون العمل</orig>, the Trade Union Work Regulation Bylaw <orig>لائحة تنظيم العمل النقابي</orig>, and the organization's internal regulations.

### Article (4):
The committee shall prepare a detailed report of all its work, which shall be presented to the first General Assembly for approval, and a copy thereof shall be submitted to the competent Minister.

### Article (5):
This resolution shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

It was decided as follows:

### Article One

#### Definitions

The following words and terms shall have the meanings assigned to each of them:
1- The Law: Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance
2- The Executive Regulations: The Executive Regulations of Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance and their amendments
3- The Unit: The Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>
4- The Authority: The Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
5- Client: A person to whom the licensed person provides, or intends to provide, services within the scope of licensed securities activities. The client includes any potential client, as well as Waqf <orig>الوقف</orig> and charitable recommendations, and also persons to whom the registered auditor provides services, or persons to whom the registered external Sharia audit office provides services.
6- Life Insurance Products: These are insurance policies whose purpose is to pay specific amounts due to death, disability, reaching a certain age, or upon the expiry of the agreed term.
7- Capital Formation Products: These are capital formation operations that include all operations whose purpose is to form capital linked to investment instruments, paid on a specific date in exchange for a premium or periodic premiums, without being linked to life or death probabilities.
8- Collective Investment Schemes: These are entities that operate in the field of employing investors' funds for the purpose of investing them on their behalf in various cases, in accordance with the principles of professional collective investment management, and are managed by a collective investment scheme manager for specific fees.

### Article Two

Companies licensed to engage in life insurance and capital formation activities and their branches must obtain the necessary licenses from the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> before launching any life insurance and capital formation product if it falls under collective investment schemes. The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall review applications for life insurance and capital formation products submitted to it to determine which of them fall under collective investment schemes, and the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> shall study the insurance aspects related to the product. Companies must regularize the status of existing products that fall under life insurance and capital formation and provide the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> with a copy of the Capital Markets Authority's <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> decision within 10 working days from its issuance date.

### Article Three

None of the companies subject to the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> and holding a license to engage in life insurance and capital formation activities and their branches may market a collective investment scheme established in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad, except after obtaining a marketing license from the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>. Companies shall submit an application to the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> to obtain the necessary licenses and regularize their status, and provide the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> with a copy of the Capital Markets Authority's <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> decision within 10 working days from its issuance date.

### Article Four

Companies subject to the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> wishing to regularize their status must disclose to the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> within 30 days of the decision's issuance and comply with the following:
- Disclose any programs they have that fall under the provisions of this decision and provide

## Article Five
Companies subject to the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> wishing to engage in life insurance and fund formation activities must disclose to the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> within 30 days of the decision's issuance and comply with the following:
*   Cease promoting and selling these programs to new clients in any form whatsoever, effective from the date of issuance of this decision.
*   Submit a quarterly report to the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> on the actions taken regarding these programs since the issuance of this decision, including the number of clients, their holdings, and any other procedures related to the implementation of this decision.
*   Take necessary measures to avoid extending investment periods for additional durations, unless required, and after notifying the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

### Article Nine

The cancellation or suspension of the registration of a registered/enrolled person shall not preclude the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> right to take any action against that person in relation to any violation committed during the period of his/her registration/enrollment.

### Article Ten

The licensed company shall be responsible for submitting an application for the registration/nomination of any individual working for it in the positions requiring registration with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>, and for following up on the related procedures, in accordance with the form prepared for this purpose and issued by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>.

### Article Eleven

An Interview Committee <orig>لجنة مقابلات</orig> shall be established within the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>, tasked with taking all necessary measures to verify the availability of technical and professional capabilities in accordance with the standards specified in its establishment decision, which qualify the candidate for the position requiring registration. A decision shall be issued by the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> naming its members, its working mechanism, the controls for registration/enrollment, and the necessary rules in this regard. The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> may conduct personal tests for candidates and/or qualification tests if required. The said committee shall submit its recommendations regarding the applications submitted to it to the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> for the issuance of an approval or rejection decision, provided that the rejection is reasoned.
In all cases, licensed companies may not appoint individuals to any of the positions requiring registration except after obtaining prior approval issued by the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>. Appointment without this approval shall be considered a violation of the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> provisions and instructions.

### Article Twelve

The licensed company shall submit an application for the registration/nomination of an individual who meets the competence and integrity rules stipulated in Annex No. (1) of this Decision for registration in the positions requiring registration with it, at least 90 days prior to the expected date of assuming the position.

### Article Thirteen

The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> may request any additional information or documents from the licensed company at any time after receiving the nomination/registration application. In the event of failure to provide the information and documents within the period specified by the committee without an acceptable excuse, the application shall be considered null and void.
The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> shall decide on the applications presented to it and that meet all requirements and documents within 90 days from the date of completion. Upon a request submitted by the committee to the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>, the decision period may be extended for one or more similar periods, provided that it does not exceed 6 months from the date of completion.

### Article Fourteen

Priority for nomination/registration for positions requiring registration shall be given to Kuwaiti citizens. In all cases, the registered/enrolled person must be

Positions Requiring Registration: The register prepared by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> for the enrollment/registration of occupants of positions requiring registration.
Nomination/Registration Application: The form and documents submitted to the Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> by the licensed company for the enrollment/registration of an individual to occupy positions requiring registration, in accordance with the procedures and conditions stipulated in this Decision.
Registered/Enrolled Person: The nominated person who meets the conditions stipulated in this Decision and whose appointment by the licensed company has been approved by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>.

### Article Two

Those subject to these rules shall adhere to the competence and integrity rules regarding the conditions required for positions requiring registration with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>, in accordance with Annex No. (1) of this Decision.

### Article Three

Without prejudice to Decision No. (58) of 2023 regarding the issuance of corporate governance rules, those subject to these rules shall adhere to the conditions required for positions requiring registration with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>, in accordance with Annex No. (2) of this Decision.

### Article Four

Annex No. (3) of this Decision specifies the accredited professional certificates for continuous education purposes. The said annex shall be updated periodically in accordance with what the Supreme Committee <orig>اللجنة العليا</orig> deems appropriate and determines.

### Article Five

Those subject to these rules shall adhere to the prescribed percentage by the competent authority according to the aforementioned law and the mechanism and controls for employing Kuwaiti labor in licensed companies, as stipulated in Annex No. (4) of this Decision. The said annex shall be updated periodically in accordance with what the Supreme Committee <orig>اللجنة العليا</orig> deems appropriate and determines.

### Article Six

Those subject to the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> supervision shall be committed to qualifying and training national cadres working in the company to obtain the professional certificates listed in Annex No. (3) of this Decision. Companies shall provide the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> with annual reports in this regard, in accordance with the regulating decisions and circulars issued by the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> in this regard.

### Article Seven

The Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> shall maintain a special register for the enrollment/registration of positions requiring registration with it. Enrollment/registration in this register shall take place after fulfilling the conditions and requirements stipulated in this Decision.

### Article Eight

The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may cancel the enrollment/registration of any person registered/enrolled with it if he/she fails to meet or violates the terms and conditions related to his/her work.
The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may also suspend the enrollment/registration of any person registered/enrolled with it and take all measures deemed appropriate to ensure that the person meets the terms and conditions related to his/her work, and may reinstate his/her enrollment/registration in the position requiring registration – for non-Kuwaiti citizens – as a resident in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in accordance with the relevant laws and decisions issued in this regard.
