## Article Twenty-Two
This decision shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette. The competent authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Chairman of the Supreme Committee
Mohammed Sulaiman Al-Otaibi <orig>محمد سليمان العتيبي</orig>

Issued on: May 22, 2025 AD
Annex No. (1) Decision No. (12) of 2025
Regarding the Conditions Required for Registrable Positions
Rules of Competence and Integrity for Registrable Positions with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>
The application of the rules of competence and integrity shall apply to licensed persons and to registrable positions with licensed persons.
A person registered in registrable positions with licensed persons must adhere to the rules of competence and integrity throughout their registration period.
If any of the conditions of the rules of competence and integrity cease to exist, the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> may cancel or suspend the registration of the registered person, and may re-register them if they meet those conditions.
The nominated person must meet the following requirements:
1. Appropriate professional experience in a field consistent with the nature of the licensed entity's work and the position for which they are nominated.
2. Passing interviews and qualifying tests as determined by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> in accordance with the issued standards.
3. Technical, leadership, and administrative capabilities that enable them to work independently, make correct decisions, and comprehend all technical requirements and developments related to workflow.
4. Commitment to fulfilling all assigned tasks and responsibilities, and working towards achieving the objectives of the licensed entity.
5. Continuous awareness of all professional and administrative updates and developments.
6. Fulfillment of the requirements stated in Annex No. (2) of this Decision.
7. Not having been subject to a final judgment for a crime against honor or trust, or related to money laundering, terrorist financing, capital market crimes, or corruption crimes, unless their reputation has been restored.
8. Being of good reputation and conduct.
9. Not having been previously dismissed from their position or job by a disciplinary decision issued by a supervisory authority or by a final judicial ruling.
10. Not having been declared bankrupt, unless their reputation has been restored or a decision has been issued for their imprisonment in fulfillment of a debt.
11. Any other conditions issued by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>.
In all cases, the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> may take all measures it deems appropriate to ensure that the nominated person meets the requirements of the integrity and trustworthiness standard, whether inside or outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

Annex No. (2) Decision No. (12) of 2025
Regarding the Conditions Required for Registrable Positions
Conditions Required for Registrable Positions with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>

## Article Fifteen
Subject to administrative circumstances that require assigning a person to perform the duties of individuals holding registrable positions for a specified period, the following must be adhered to:
1. Notifying the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> of the details of the person assigned to perform the duties of the holder of the registrable position, specifying the period and the powers granted to them.
2. The assignment period shall not exceed 6 months, and may be extended after obtaining prior approval from the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

## Article Sixteen
Subject to the provisions of Article No. (15) of this Decision, only those registered/enrolled in the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> records may hold registrable positions in any form whatsoever.

## Article Seventeen
Under no circumstances may a person registered/enrolled in the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> register of registrable positions hold any registrable position for more than one licensed company.

## Article Eighteen
In cases where a registrable position is vacant, licensed companies must adhere to the following:
1. Notifying the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> upon the termination of a person's occupancy of a registrable position within five working days from the date of the vacancy, in accordance with the form prepared for this purpose.
2. Filling the registrable position within six months from the date of notifying the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

## Article Nineteen
A fee of two hundred Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 200) <orig>مئتان دينار كويتي</orig> shall be collected for each application submitted by licensed companies for nomination/registration in a registrable position. Payment shall be made upon submission of the application, and no application that fails to pay the fee will be considered.

## Article Twenty
Violation of this Decision shall entail legal liability as stipulated in the Law and its Executive Regulations, without prejudice to other relevant laws.

## Article Twenty-One
The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> shall issue all necessary executive decisions for the establishment of the Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> responsible for reviewing nomination/registration applications for registrable positions, as well as decisions related to the committee's controls and procedures and the mechanism for submitting registration/enrollment applications within 3 months from the date this Decision comes into effect. Companies shall be granted a grace period to submit their applications and regularize their status until 31/03/2026.

## Registrable Positions
## Requirements, Academic Qualifications, Professional Certificates, and Practical Experience

*   **Chief Executive Officer and those of similar status**
    *   Signing a declaration and undertaking to review and understand Law No. 125 of 2019 <orig>القانون رقم 125 لسنة 2019</orig> concerning the regulation of insurance and its executive regulations and amendments, and to regularly follow up on all decisions and circulars issued by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance / financial / legal / administrative field or a related field for a period of no less than 12 years.
    *   Holds one of the accredited professional certificates in the insurance field listed in Appendix No. (3) <orig>الملحق رقم (3)</orig> or similar certificates approved by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>. Those with more than 15 years of experience in the insurance field are exempt from the professional certificate requirement.

*   **Senior Executives and those of similar status appointed in insurance activities**
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance / financial / legal / administrative field or a related field for a period of no less than 10 years.
    *   Holds one of the accredited professional certificates in the insurance field listed in Appendix No. (3) <orig>الملحق رقم (3)</orig> or similar certificates approved by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>. Those with more than 15 years of experience in the insurance field are exempt from the professional certificate requirement.

*   **Risk Management Director and those of similar status**
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the field of risk management for a period of no less than 8 years.
    *   Holds one of the accredited professional certificates in the field of risk management listed in Appendix No. (3) <orig>الملحق رقم (3)</orig> or similar certificates approved by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

*   **Compliance Officer and those of similar status**
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance / financial / legal / administrative field or a related field for a period of no less than 5 years.
    *   Holds one of the accredited professional certificates in the field of anti-money laundering and combating terrorist financing and/or regulatory compliance listed in Appendix No. (3) <orig>الملحق رقم (3)</orig> or similar certificates approved by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

*   **Internal Sharia Auditor and those of similar status**
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the field of Sharia auditing <orig>التدقيق الشرعي</orig> for a period of no less than 3 years.
    *   Holds one of the accredited professional certificates in the field of Sharia auditing <orig>التدقيق الشرعي</orig> listed in Appendix No. (3) <orig>الملحق رقم (3)</orig> or similar certificates approved by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

*   **Financial Manager and those of similar status**
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the field of financial control / financial management / internal auditing / accounting work, or a related field for a period of no less than 10 years.
    *   Holds one of the accredited professional certificates in the financial field listed in Appendix No. (3) <orig>الملحق رقم (3)</orig> or similar certificates approved by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>. Those with more than 15 years of experience in the financial field are exempt from the professional certificate requirement.

*   **Internal Audit Officer and those of similar status**
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the field of internal auditing or a related field for a period of no less than 10 years.
    *   Holds one of the accredited professional certificates in the field of internal auditing listed in Appendix No. (2) <orig>الملحق رقم (2)</orig> or similar certificates approved by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>. Those with more than 15 years of experience in the financial field are exempt from the professional certificate requirement.

*   **Legal Affairs Director and those of similar status**
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the field of legal affairs for a period of no less than 10 years.

*   **Insurance Broker Manager and/or Reinsurance Broker**
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance field for a period of no less than 7 years.
    *   Holds a post-secondary diploma or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance field for a period of no less than 10 years.
    *   Holds a secondary school qualification or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance field for a period of no less than 12 years.
    *   Holds one of the accredited professional certificates in the insurance field listed in Appendix No. (3) <orig>الملحق رقم (3)</orig> or similar certificates approved by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>. Those with more than 15 years of experience in the insurance field are exempt from the professional certificate requirement.

*   **Insurance Agent Manager**
    *   Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance field for a period of no less than 7 years.

It was decided as follows:
Article One
The following words and terms shall have the meaning indicated next to each of them:
- The Law: Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
- The Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>: The Executive Regulations of Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig> and its amendments.
- The Unit: The Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
- Interviews Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig>: The committee for which a decision has been issued by the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> and is specialized in taking all necessary measures to verify the availability of technical and professional capabilities in accordance with the standards specified in its establishment decision, which qualify the candidate for the position requiring registration.
- Positions Requiring Registration <orig>المناصب واجبة التسجيل</orig>: It is the position of an independent board member whose occupant is required to be registered with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> in accordance with the conditions and procedures contained in this Resolution and before commencing their duties.
- Competence and Integrity Rules <orig>قواعد الكفاءة والنزاهة</orig>: A set of standards and procedures stipulated in this Resolution to ensure the eligibility of the candidate for the position requiring registration in terms of experience, qualifications, integrity, and financial probity.
- Licensed Company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig>: A company licensed by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> and committed to the provisions of the Law <orig>القانون</orig>, the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>, and the resolutions and circulars issued by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.
- Register of Positions
Requiring Registration <orig>سجل المناصب واجبة التسجيل</orig>: The register prepared by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> for the registration of occupants of positions requiring registration.
- Nomination / Registration Application <orig>طلب الترشيح / التسجيل</orig>: The form and documents submitted to the Interviews Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> by the Licensed Company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> for the registration of a person to occupy positions requiring registration in accordance with the procedures and requirements contained in this Resolution.
- Registered Person <orig>الشخص المقيد / المسجل</orig>: The nominated person who meets the conditions contained in this Resolution and whose appointment has been approved by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> at the Licensed Company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig>.

Appendix No. (4) of Resolution No. (12) of 2025
Regarding the Conditions Required for Positions Requiring Registration
Mechanism and Controls for Employing Kuwaiti Labor for Subject Entities
Entities subject to the provisions of Law No. (125) of 2019 and its Executive Regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig> and their amendments shall adhere to the specified percentage for national cadres working in the insurance sector, based on decisions issued by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> and/or the competent authorities, in terms of percentage and academic qualifications, through the following conditions:
1- Companies' commitment to the percentage specified by the competent authority to meet the quota of Kuwaiti national labor <orig>العمالة الوطنية الكويتية</orig> from the total workforce and any amendments to this percentage.
2- Distribution of the Kuwaiti national labor <orig>العمالة الوطنية الكويتية</orig> quota across various departments of the company and not limiting it to a single department for the purpose of meeting the quota.
3- Application of the Kuwaiti national labor <orig>العمالة الوطنية الكويتية</orig> quota to the licensee's job grades and job titles, and not limiting it to a single job grade or title for the purpose of meeting the quota.
4- Employment of various academic qualifications, especially those with a university degree, and not restricting the employment process to those with diploma and high school certificates.
5- Providing necessary training and qualification programs for all company employees annually, in accordance with the professional certificates listed in Appendix No. (3).
6- Providing remote (online) training programs through video conferencing if training programs are delivered by international personnel.
7- Establishing an internal policy regarding the process of attracting Kuwaiti national labor <orig>العمالة الوطنية الكويتية</orig> and employees, and the company's needs percentage across its various departments at the end of each fiscal year.
8- The internal policy must include:
    a- The number of employees the company wishes to hire to complete the Kuwaiti labor quota.
    b- Advertising company vacancies and the method of publishing the advertisement through the company's website and social media.
    c- Defining job requirements for fresh graduates and experienced individuals.
9- Any other data or conditions specified by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

### Article Two
Those subject to this Resolution shall adhere to the rules of efficiency and integrity regarding the conditions that must be met for positions requiring registration with the Unit, in accordance with Annex No. (1) of this Resolution.

### Article Three
Subject to Resolution No. (58) of 2023 regarding the issuance of corporate governance rules, those subject to this Resolution shall adhere to the conditions that must be met for positions requiring registration with the Unit, in accordance with Annex No. (2) of this Resolution.

### Article Four
The Unit shall maintain a special register for the registration of positions requiring registration with it. Registration in this register shall take place after fulfilling the conditions and requirements stipulated in this Resolution.

### Article Five
The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may cancel the registration / enrollment of any person registered / enrolled with it in the event of non-fulfillment or violation of the terms and conditions related to their work. The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may also suspend the registration / enrollment of any person registered / enrolled with it and take all measures deemed appropriate to ensure that the person fulfills the terms and conditions related to their work, and may reinstate their registration / enrollment if it is found that they have not violated those terms and conditions.

### Article Six
The cancellation or suspension of the registration of a registered / enrolled person shall not preclude the Unit's right to take any action against this person in relation to any violation committed during their period of registration / enrollment.

### Article Seven
The licensed company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> shall be responsible for submitting an application for registration / nomination of any individual working for it in positions requiring registration with the Unit and following up on the related procedures, in accordance with the form prepared for this purpose and issued by a resolution of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>.

### Article Eight
An Interview Committee <orig>لجنة مقابلات</orig> shall be established within the Unit, tasked with taking all necessary measures to verify the availability of technical and professional capabilities, in accordance with the criteria specified in its establishment resolution, which qualify the candidate for the registrable position. A resolution shall be issued by the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> naming its members, its working mechanism, the controls for registration / enrollment, and the necessary rules in this regard. The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> may conduct personal interviews for candidates and/or qualifying tests if deemed necessary. The said Committee shall submit its recommendations regarding the applications submitted to it to the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> for issuing a decision of approval or rejection, provided that the rejection is reasoned. In all cases, licensed companies <orig>الشركات المرخص لها</orig> may not appoint individuals to a registrable position except after obtaining prior approval from the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>. Appointment without this approval shall be considered a violation of the Unit's provisions and instructions.

### Article Nine
The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> may, at any time after receiving an application for nomination / registration for registrable positions, request the licensed company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> to provide any additional information or documents. In the event of failure to provide the information and documents within the period specified by the Committee without an acceptable excuse, the application shall be deemed null and void. The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> shall decide on the applications presented to it that fulfill all requests and documents within 90 days from the date of fulfillment. Upon a request submitted by the Committee, the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may extend the decision period to one or more similar periods, provided that it does not exceed 6 months from the date of fulfillment.

### Article Ten
Priority for nomination / registration for a registrable position shall be given to Kuwaiti citizens <orig>المواطن الكويتي</orig>. In all cases, a person registered / enrolled in a registrable position – if not a Kuwaiti citizen <orig>المواطن الكويتي</orig> – must be a resident of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in accordance with the relevant laws and resolutions issued in this regard.

### Article Eleven
Subject to the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the same person may not be appointed to registrable positions in more than one licensed company <orig>شركة مرخص لها</orig> except after obtaining prior approval from the Unit for each position separately, in accordance with the procedures and conditions stipulated in this Resolution and any other resolutions issued in this regard. In all cases, individuals not registered and enrolled in the Unit's registers may not occupy registrable positions in any way whatsoever.

### Article Twelve
In cases where a registrable position is vacant, licensed companies <orig>الشركات المرخص لها</orig> shall adhere to the following:
1- Notify the Unit upon the termination of an individual's occupancy of a registrable position within five working days from the date this position becomes vacant, in accordance with the form prepared for this purpose and issued by a resolution of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>.
2- Fill the registrable position within six months from the date of notifying the Unit.

### Article Thirteen
A fee of two hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (KWD 200) shall be collected for each application submitted by licensed companies <orig>الشركات المرخص لها</orig> for nomination / registration in registrable positions. Payment shall be made upon submission of the application, and no application for which the fee has not been paid shall be considered.

### Article Fourteen
Violation of this Resolution shall entail legal liability as stipulated in the Law and its Executive Regulations, without prejudice to other relevant laws.

### Article Fifteen
The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> shall issue all executive resolutions necessary for the establishment of the Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> responsible for reviewing applications for nomination / registration for registrable positions, as well as resolutions pertaining to the controls and procedures for the Committee's work and the mechanism for submitting registration / enrollment applications, within 3 months from the date this Resolution comes into effect. Companies shall be granted a grace period to submit their applications and regularize their status until 31/03/2026.

## Annex No. (1) of Decision No. (13) of 2025
### Regarding the Conditions Required for Mandatory Registration Positions (Independent Board Member)

**Competence and Integrity Rules for Positions Requiring Registration with the Unit**
The application of competence and integrity rules applies to licensed persons and to positions requiring registration with licensed persons.
The person registered in mandatory registration positions with licensed persons must adhere to the competence and integrity rules throughout their registration period.
If any of the conditions for competence and integrity rules cease to be met, the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> may cancel or suspend the registration of the registered person, and may re-register them if they fulfill those conditions.

The nominated person must meet the following:
1.  Appropriate professional experience in a field consistent with the nature of the licensed entity's work and the position for which they are nominated.
2.  Passing qualifying interviews and tests as determined by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> according to the issued standards.
3.  Technical, leadership, and administrative capabilities that enable them to work independently, make correct decisions, and comprehend all technical requirements and developments related to workflow.
4.  Commitment to fulfilling all assigned tasks and responsibilities, and working towards achieving the objectives of the licensed entity.
5.  Continuous awareness of all professional and administrative updates and developments.
6.  Fulfillment of the requirements stipulated in Annex No. (2) of this decision.
7.  Not to have been convicted by a judicial judgment for a crime involving breach of honor or trust, or related to money laundering, terrorist financing, capital market crimes, or corruption crimes, unless their reputation has been restored.
8.  To be of good reputation and conduct.
9.  Not to have been previously dismissed from their position or job by a disciplinary decision issued by a supervisory authority or by a final judicial ruling.
10. Not to have been declared bankrupt, unless their reputation has been restored or a decision has been issued for their imprisonment in fulfillment of a debt.
11. Any other conditions issued by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

In all cases, the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> may take all measures it deems appropriate to ensure that the nominated person meets the requirements of the integrity and honesty standard, whether inside or outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

## Annex No. (2) of Decision No. (13) of 2025

## Resolution No. 1 / 84 – R / 2025

## Minutes of Announcement of Sale of Seized Assets
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> – Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> – announces that on Wednesday, 4/6/2025, at 10:30 AM, the seized assets of Mr. Kitchen Ready-Made Kitchens Company <orig>شركة مستر كيتشن المطابخ الجاهزة</orig> will be sold by public auction at the company's premises located in Shuwaikh Industrial Area <orig>الشويخ الصناعية</orig> – Plot 1 <orig>قطعة 1</orig> – Street 25 <orig>شارع 25</orig> – Parcel 53 <orig>قسيمة 53</orig>. These assets are detailed in the enforcement seizure minutes dated 28/4/2025, and were seized in favor of/ Mohammed Hameed Taqi Akbar <orig>محمد حميد تقي أكبر</orig>, in execution of Judgment No. 2023/2904 Commercial Plenary/50, for the settlement of an amount of (2,973,905 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig>).
If this day is not sufficient to complete the sale, it will be completed on the following three days. Therefore, those wishing to purchase must attend at the time and place specified above. ## Resolution No. H.A.S. (22) of 2025
### Regarding the Imposition of an Administrative Penalty
The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig> and its Executive Regulations and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Resolution No. (5/5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025 AD, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
*   The violation report submitted by the Environmental Control Department <orig>قسم الرقابة البيئية</orig> No. (C-45) dated 27/10/2024 AD, which includes the commission of the following violation by / Al-Habs Aluminum Workshops Company <orig>شركة الهابس لورش الألومنيوم</orig>:
    *   Establishing a project, engaging in an activity, or adding a product without obtaining the approval of the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig>, in violation of Article (16) of Environmental Protection Law <orig>قانون حماية البيئة</orig> No. 42/2014 and its amendments.
*   The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (13/2024/494) held on 18/12/2024.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr./ Deputy Director General for Industrial Standards and Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
And in furtherance of the public interest.
Has decided
(Article One)
To warn / Al-Habs Aluminum Workshops Company <orig>شركة الهابس لورش الألومنيوم</orig>.
Located in Al-Rai Area <orig>منطقة الري</orig> – Plot (1) – Parcel (1752) – Shop No. (26), Ground Floor, of the necessity to remove the aforementioned violation within a maximum period of (three months). In the event of failure to remove the violation, stricter measures will be taken in accordance with the rules applicable in this regard.
(Article Two)
This resolution shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.
Issued on: 7 May 2025 AD
Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

# Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>
Announcement of Public Practice No. (DA/M/750) for Providing Central Kitchen Cleaning Services at the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>
The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (DA/M/750) for providing central kitchen cleaning services at the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>. Companies or specialized establishments wishing to participate in this field should apply to obtain the terms and conditions booklet and practice documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig>), during official working hours starting from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), for a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 150/-) only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (K-Net payment only) for the booklet, during official working hours from 8:30 AM to 1:30 PM, taking into account the following:
1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:30 PM on Thursday, 29/5/2025 AD, and no bids will be accepted after this time.
2- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig> – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3- Submission of an initial security deposit of 2% of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
4- Submission of a valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate and a tax compliance certificate.
5- A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID for the company's representative to purchase the practice document.
6- This practice is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The practitioner must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving its right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.
For inquiries, please call the following numbers:
Direct: 22011437-22011427
Email: Ma.almatouq@da.gov.kw
Undersecretary for Financial, Administrative, and Staff Affairs

## Resolution No. H.A.S. (26) of 2025
### Regarding the Closure of a Plot

The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industrial Law and its Executive Regulations and amendments.
*   Ministerial Resolution No. (2025/5) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
*   The violation report submitted by the Environmental Control Department <orig>قسم الرقابة البيئية</orig> No. (C-42), dated 27/10/2024, which includes the following violations committed by Al-Watan Paper Tissue Production Factory <orig>مصنع الوطن لإنتاج محارم الورق</orig>:
    *   Establishing a project, engaging in an activity, or adding a product without obtaining the approval of the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig>, in violation of Article (16) of Environmental Protection Law No. 42/2014 and its amendments.
    *   Failure to use modern, advanced, and environmentally friendly technologies in production processes and ventilation systems.
    *   Insufficient ventilation in production and storage areas.
    *   Random storage.
*   The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (494/2024/13) held on 18/12/2024.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Industrial Standards and Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has decided
(Article One)
To close plot No. (1868) - (entire basement) - located in Al-Rai <orig>الري</orig> area - Block (1) - belonging to Al-Watan Paper Tissue Production Company <orig>شركة الوطن لإنتاج محارم الورق</orig> - until the violations and their consequences are removed.
(Article Two)
In the event of failure to remove the violation after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.
(Article Three)

The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the above announcement, which is the last deadline for depositing bids.
- Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission and deposit of bids on the CD available on the Agency's website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
- The aforementioned cash payment must be made by certified check or K-Net card.
- The last deadline for receiving inquiries and clarifications from companies is 09-06-2025, and no inquiries or clarifications received after this date will be considered.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, except for the bid form and preliminary bond, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- Non-divisible.
- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
- The bidder must attach a valid certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector, noting that bids not including this certificate will be excluded.
This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid opening session.
- Interested companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department <orig>قسم فض العطاءات</orig> before the specified date for the bid opening session and bring the following documents: -
1. Copy of the Civil ID.
2. Copy of the authorized signature for the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
3. In case of attendance by a person other than the authorized signatory, a written letter from the authorized signatory at the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات</orig> must be provided, authorizing the chosen representative to attend the session.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة و المتوسطة</orig> are exempt from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with Article (39) of Law No. 49/2016 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to bid must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Care and Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة و المتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- This announcement is considered an integral part of the tender documents.
- For more information, please visit our website at WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.

The General Directorate of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (01-2026/2025) for the maintenance, operation, and management of the water treatment plant at Al-Tahrir Camp <orig>معسكر التحرير</orig>, in accordance with the conditions stipulated in the practice documents.

(seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), non-refundable. Payment is made through the National Guard <orig>الحرس الوطني</orig> website using the (K-NET) service.

## Announcement
The owners of Rukn Al-Alamiyah for Building Contracting Company <orig>ركن العالمية للمقاولات للمباني</orig> have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> to amend the company's legal entity from a General Partnership Company <orig>شركة تضامنية</orig> to the new legal entity of a Limited Liability Company <orig>شركة ذات مسئولية محدودة</orig>.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners <orig>الشركاء المتضامنين</orig> in the case of a general partnership <orig>التضامنية</orig> or simple limited partnership <orig>التوصية البسيطة</orig> only in the face of this creditor, until their objection is decided by a judicial ruling.

### Al-Argan International Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الأرجان العالمية العقارية</orig>
**Kuwaiti Public Shareholding Company**

**Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting**
The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of the shareholders of Al-Argan International Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الأرجان العالمية العقارية</orig> – a Kuwaiti Public Shareholding Company – for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2024 AD, was held at 11:30 AM on Monday, May 12, 2025, at the company's main headquarters, "Al-Argan Business Complex <orig>مجمع الأرجان للأعمال</orig>", located in the Free Trade Zone – Block (F98) – in the main hall.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Haitham Sulaiman Hamoud Al-Khaled <orig>هيثم سليمان حمود الخالد</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The following also attended the meeting:
- Mr. / Eng. Khaled Khudair Mishaan Al-Khudair <orig>خالد خضير مشعان الخضير</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer
- Mr. Mohamed Abdelmoeid <orig>محمد عبدالمعيد</orig> – Group Chief Financial Officer
- Mr. Mohamed Hussein Al-Jareetly <orig>محمد حسين الجريتلي</orig> – Financial Controller
- Mr. Nayef Musaed Al-Yaseen <orig>نايف مساعد الياسين</orig> – Company Auditor from RSM Al-Bazie & Partners <orig>RSM البزيع وشركاهم</orig> by authorization
- Mr. Mohamed Bouhadi <orig>محمد بوهادي</orig> – Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>
Shareholders holding 204,795,844 shares, in person and by proxy, attended the meeting through electronic voting and direct attendance. They represented 77.281% of the company's total free shares, which number 265,000,000 shares after excluding treasury shares. Shareholders who participated through direct attendance represented 61.575% of the company's total free shares. The percentage of shareholders in electronic voting represented 15.706% of the company's total free shares.

The value of the increase is KWD 2,650,000 (Two Million Six Hundred Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), divided into 26,500,000 shares, with each share valued at KWD 0.100 (100 Kuwaiti fils <orig>فلس كويتي</orig>). ### Article (12) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
Capital may not be increased unless the installments of shares have been fully paid. New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value. If issued for a higher value, the increase shall first be allocated to cover issuance expenses, then to the reserve or for the redemption of shares.

### Article (12) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly may authorize the Board of Directors to determine the date of its implementation.

### Article (13) of the Articles of Association before Amendment
For the purpose of retaining competent employees to work for the Company and enhancing their loyalty to it, the Board of Directors has the right to establish a system called the Employee Stock Option Plan <orig>خيار شراء الأسهم للموظفين</orig>, in accordance with the conditions stipulated in Ministerial Resolution No. (337) of 2004.
- 1- To meet the Company's obligations under the Employee Stock Option Plan <orig>نظام خيار شراء الأسهم للموظفين</orig>, the Company's capital may be increased, provided that the total increases to the paid-up capital do not exceed 10% over a maximum period of ten years from the start of the program's implementation.
- 2- The annual report of the Board of Directors to the shareholders must include the job levels benefiting from the program and the quantity of shares allocated to each job level.
- 3- The Employee Stock Option Plan <orig>نظام خيار شراء الأسهم للموظفين</orig> and its program shall be presented to the General Assembly for approval.

### Article (13) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by one or both of the following limitations:
- 1- Requiring a right of pre-emption for the Company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
- 2- Requiring the Board of Directors' approval of the share buyer.
Dispositions referred to in Article (172) of this Law are excluded from these two limitations.
- Before disposing of their shares, the shareholder must notify the Company of the commencement of the sale. The disposition of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder submits a request to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.
- Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the Company's purchase of its own shares, if the Board of Directors rejects the buyer, it must purchase the shares on behalf of the Company within ten days from the date the Board is notified of the approval request. In this case, the purchase shall be at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell their shares.

### Article (14) of the Articles of Association before Amendment
The Company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (3) three members elected by the General Assembly through secret ballot.

### Article (14) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The Company shall be managed by a Board of Directors, the method of its formation, the number of its members, and the term of membership therein shall be specified in the Company's Articles of Association. The number of Board members shall not be less than five. The term of membership in the Board shall be three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the Company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board is elected.

### Article (15) of the Articles of Association before Amendment
The term of membership of the Board of Directors is three years, renewable.

### Article (15) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot. The Company's Articles of Association may stipulate the election of a number not exceeding half of the Board of Directors members.

### Text of Article 3 of the Articles of Association before Amendment
The duration of this Company is indefinite and commences from the date of its registration in the Commercial Register and the publication of the official instrument of its establishment in the Official Gazette.

### Text of Article 3 of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The duration of this Company is indefinite and commences from the date of publication.

### Article (4) of the Company's Articles of Association and Article (5) of the Memorandum of Incorporation before Amendment
The purposes for which the Company was established are as follows:
- 1- Owning shares in Kuwaiti or foreign shareholding companies, as well as owning shares or stakes in Kuwaiti or foreign limited liability companies, or participating in the establishment of both types of these companies, managing them, lending to them, and guaranteeing them to third parties.
- 2- Lending to companies in which it owns shares and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20%.
- 3- Owning industrial property rights such as patents, industrial trademarks, industrial designs, or any other related rights, and leasing them to other companies for exploitation, whether inside or outside Kuwait.
- 4- Owning movable and immovable properties necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law.
- 5- Utilizing the Company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
The Company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.

### Article (4) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
- 642051 (1) Owning shares solely for the account of the holding company.
- 642040 (2) Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent.
- 642050 (3) Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiaries and others.
- 642030 (4) Owning real estate and movable properties necessary for carrying out its business within the limits permitted by law.
- 642020 (5) Investing its funds in shares, bonds, and other securities.
- 642010 (6) Managing its subsidiaries or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares and providing them with necessary support.
- 642070 (7) Business management office for holding activities.

### Article 6 of the Articles of Association before Amendment
The Company's shares are nominal, and non-Kuwaitis may own them in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial resolutions regulating this.

### Article 6 of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The Company's shares are nominal, and non-Kuwaitis may not own them in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial resolutions regulating this.

### Article (10) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
Each share grants its owner the right to an equal share, without discrimination, in the ownership of the Company's assets and in the distributed profits as specified hereinafter.

The Vice-Chairman shall replace the Chairman in his absence or if there is an impediment preventing him from exercising his powers. The company shall have one or more Chief Executive Officers appointed by the Board of Directors from among the members of the Board or from others, entrusted with the management of the company. ### Article (16) of the Company's Articles of Association Before Amendment
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership on the Board of Directors:
-1 Must possess legal capacity to act.
-2 Must not have been previously convicted of a felony punishable by a custodial sentence, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a custodial sentence for violating the provisions of this law, unless his reputation has been restored.
-3 Must personally own, or the person he represents must own, a number of the company's shares. If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the aforementioned conditions, his membership shall cease.

### Article (16) of the Company's Articles of Association After Amendment
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership on the Board of Directors:
-1 Must possess legal capacity to act.
-2 Must not have been previously convicted of a felony punishable by a custodial sentence, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a custodial sentence for violating the provisions of this law, unless his reputation has been restored.
-3 Except for independent board members, must personally own, or the person he represents must own, a number of the company's shares.
-4 Any other conditions stipulated in the Articles of Incorporation.
If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the aforementioned conditions or any other conditions stated in this law or other laws, his membership shall cease from the date of losing that condition.

### Article (19) of the Company's Articles of Association Before Amendment
The Board of Directors shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman for three years, provided that this period does not exceed their term of membership on the Board of Directors. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company before the judiciary and third parties, and shall implement the decisions issued by the Board. The Vice-Chairman shall assume the duties of the Chairman in his absence or if there is an impediment preventing him from doing so.

### Article (19) of the Company's Articles of Association After Amendment
The Board of Directors shall elect - by secret ballot - a Chairman of the Board and a Vice-Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other powers specified in the company's contract. His signature shall be considered the signature of the Board of Directors in the company's relationship with third parties, and he shall implement the Board's decisions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman shall replace the Chairman in his absence or if there is an impediment preventing him from exercising his powers.

### Article (20) of the Company's Articles of Association Before Amendment
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer appointed by the Board of Directors from among the members of the Board or from others, entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall determine his allocations and powers to sign on behalf of the company.

The provisions related to the constituent assembly stipulated in Companies Law No. 25 of 2012 shall apply to the procedures for convening the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, the quorum for attendance, and voting.

Article (29) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The Annual Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months following the end of the financial year, at the time and place specified by the company's articles of incorporation. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may invite the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> to meet whenever necessary. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must issue an invitation for the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> to meet based on a reasoned request from a number of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> owning no less than ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>. This must be done within 21 days from the date of the request. The inviting party shall prepare the agenda. The inviting party shall prepare the agenda.
In closed joint-stock companies <orig>الشركات المساهمة المقفلة</orig>, the Chairman of the General Assembly <orig>رئيس الجمعية العامة</orig>, the Secretary of the Board of Directors <orig>أمين سر مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and one of the minority shareholders present shall record the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> and any reservations of the shareholders, if any, ratify them, and submit a report on these resolutions and reservations to the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.
The provisions related to the constituent assembly stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 shall apply to the procedures for convening the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, the quorum for attendance, and voting.

Article (30) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
In cases where the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may be convened at the request of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, auditors <orig>مراقبي الحسابات</orig>, or the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, the agenda shall be set by the request for convening the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig>, and no matter not included in the agenda may be discussed.

Article (30) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> must invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to meet within fifteen days if the invitation for the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> meeting was not issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for any reason in cases where the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> is required to invite the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> to meet.
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall replace the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in taking the necessary procedures to convene the meeting, and it may chair the meeting, unless the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> elects one of the shareholders for this purpose.

Article (31) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
Each shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> shall have a number of votes equal to the number of his shares. Representation by proxy <orig>التوكيل</orig> is permitted for attending the meeting, and minors <orig>القصر</orig> and interdicted persons <orig>المحجورين</orig> shall be represented by their legal representatives. No member may participate in voting on his own behalf or on behalf of whom he legally represents in matters related to a special interest for him or a conflict existing between him and the company.

Article (31) of the Company's Articles of Association after Amendment
Each shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig>, regardless of the number of his shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> may not vote on his own behalf or on behalf of whom he legally represents in matters related to a special interest for him, or a conflict existing between him and the company. Any condition or resolution that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> may appoint another person to attend on his behalf. The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall issue the rules regulating the disclosures required for proxies <orig>التوكيلات</orig> for those attending on behalf of a shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> at the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig>.
Anyone claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to issue an order on petition <orig>أمر على عريضة</orig> to deprive the disputed shares <orig>الأسهم المتنازع عليها</orig> of voting for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is

2- If the balance sheet and profit and loss accounts are consistent with reality, include
everything stipulated by law and the company's articles of association, and honestly and clearly express the company's true financial position.
3- If the company maintains regular accounts.
4- If the inventory has been conducted according to accepted principles.
5- If the data contained in the Board of Directors' report is consistent with what is recorded in

7- Any other data specified by the executive regulations.
Article (46) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> Before Amendment
A percentage determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be deducted from the gross non-net profits for the depreciation of
the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase
necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to
shareholders.

Distribution of net profits as follows:
1- Ten percent (10%) shall be deducted and allocated to the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> account, unless the
Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> specify a higher percentage. The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may cease this deduction if the
statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.
2- One percent (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>الكويت لتقدم العلمي</orig> account.
3- A percentage shall be deducted and allocated to the optional reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الاختياري</orig> account, proposed by the Board of
Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and approved by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>. This deduction shall be ceased by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العادية</orig>
based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4- A portion of the profits shall be deducted based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and approved by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>
to meet the company's obligations under labor laws. These funds may not be distributed to
shareholders.
5- A necessary amount shall be deducted for the distribution of a first dividend of five percent (5%)
to shareholders, as determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and approved by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
6- After the foregoing, an amount determined by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, not exceeding
ten percent (10%) of the remainder, shall be deducted and allocated as remuneration for the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7- The remaining profits shall then be distributed to shareholders as an additional share in profits,
or carried forward to the next year based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or allocated to establish a general
reserve fund or an extraordinary depreciation fund.

Article 46 of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> After Amendment
Annually, by a resolution issued by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>,
a percentage of not less than ten percent (10%) of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's
issued capital.
The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of
profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent (5%) of the paid-up capital in
years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the
absence of an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> that would permit the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What was deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be returned to it when the profits of
subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.

Article 48 of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> Before Amendment
. Dividends shall be paid to shareholders at the place and times determined by the Board of
Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
or by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must convene an Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>
meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to convene the Assembly within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph,
the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall call for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period
referred to in the preceding paragraph.

Article (43) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> Before Amendment
The company's financial year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year,
with the exception of the company's first financial year, which begins on the date of the company's establishment announcement
and ends on December 31st of the following year.

Article (43) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> After Amendment
The company shall have a financial year of not less than twelve months, the beginning and end of which shall be determined by the
company's articles of association. The first financial year is an exception, starting from the date of the company's registration in
the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ending on the specified date for the end of the following financial year.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall prepare an annual report on the ended financial year, and the executive regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>
shall specify the details thereof.

Article (44) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> Before Amendment
The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall have the powers and obligations stipulated in the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>
and Law No. 5 of 1981 <orig>قانون مزاولة مهنة مراقبي الحسابات رقم 5 لسنة 1981</orig> concerning the practice of the auditing profession. Specifically, he shall have the
right at any time to inspect all the company's books, records, and documents, and to
request any data he deems necessary to obtain. He also has the right to verify the company's assets
and liabilities. If he is unable to exercise these powers, he shall state this in writing
in a report submitted to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and presented to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and he has the right to call for a General
Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting for this purpose.

Article (44) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> After Amendment
The auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, in accordance with Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig>, shall at all times
have the right to inspect all the company's books, records, and documents, and to request any data
he deems necessary to obtain. He also has the right to verify the company's assets and liabilities.
In the event that he is prevented from exercising these rights, he must state this in writing in a report
submitted to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and presented to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, and the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> and the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall be notified thereof.

Article (45) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> Before Amendment
The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall submit a report to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> stating whether the balance sheet and profit
and loss account are consistent with reality and honestly and clearly express the company's true financial position,
whether the company maintains regular accounts, whether the inventory has been
conducted according to accepted principles, whether the data contained in the Board of Directors' report is
consistent with what is recorded in the company's books, and whether there were violations of the company's
regulations, legal provisions, or international accounting standards that occurred during the
financial year in a manner affecting the company's activity or financial position, with an indication of whether
these violations are still ongoing, within the limits of the information available to him. The
auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall be responsible for the accuracy of the data contained in his report in his capacity as an agent for all
shareholders. Every shareholder, during the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, has the right to discuss with the auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> and
seek clarification on what is stated in his report.

Article (45) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> After Amendment
The auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> or his representative from among the accountants who participated with him in the audit
work, shall attend the meetings of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> and submit a report on the company's financial
statements, and whether these statements show the company's financial position at the end of
the financial year and the results of the company's operations for that year, and a statement as to whether the data contained
in the Board of Directors' report is consistent with what is recorded in the company's books and documents,
in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and what is stipulated by law.
If the company has more than one auditor <orig>مراقب للحسابات</orig>, they shall prepare a unified report. In
case of disagreement among them on certain matters, this must be stated in the report, along with
each one's point of view.

*   Representative of Gulf Securities Depository Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig> Mr. Omar Osama Al-Zawawi <orig>عمر أسامة الزواوي</orig>.
*   Mr. Ahmed Ismail Youssef <orig>أحمد إسماعيل يوسف</orig> authorized by Mr. Qais Mohammed Al-Nisf <orig>قيس محمد النصف</orig> – BDO Al-Nisf & Partners <orig>BDO النصف وشركاه</orig>, Independent Auditor.

After the legal quorum of 93.8272% was met for the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, Mr. Mohammed Fahad Al-Duwaihees <orig>محمد فهاد الدويهيس</orig> opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees and thanking them for accepting the invitation, then proceeded to discuss the agenda as follows:
**First: Consideration of the Company's Future:**
The Chairman of the Board of Directors, Mr. Mohammed Fahad Al-Duwaihees <orig>محمد فهاد الدويهيس</orig>, clarified the company's situation and reported the Board of Directors' recommendation for liquidation. The attendees unanimously approved the recommendation and the company's liquidation.
**Second: Appointment of a Liquidator, Determination of Fees, and Liquidation Period:**
The appointment of Mr. Ahmed Tawfiq Al-Rashid <orig>أحمد توفيق الرشيد</orig> as the company's liquidator was unanimously approved. His fees were set at (2500 K.D.) <orig>2500 د.ك</orig>, and the liquidation period shall be one year.
At the end of the meeting, Mr. Mohammed Fahad Al-Duwaihees <orig>محمد فهاد الدويهيس</orig>, in his capacity as Chairman of the session, thanked the attendees, and the meeting concluded at 12:00 PM.

# Al-Enezi International Company for Structures and Engineering Industries (K.S.C.C. Closed) <orig>شركة العنزي الدولية للهياكل والصناعات الهندسية (ش.م.ك. مقفلة)</orig>,
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Wednesday, 2025/04/30, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Al-Enezi International Company for Structures and Engineering Industries (K.S.C.C. Closed) <orig>شركة العنزي الدولية للهياكل والصناعات الهندسية (ش.م.ك. مقفلة)</orig> was held to amend the articles of association and the company's bylaws in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
The meeting commenced at 10:00 AM at the company's headquarters located in Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> area – Beirut Street <orig>شارع بيروت</orig> – directly behind Hawally Central <orig>سنترال حولي</orig> – Building No. 2 – First Floor, with 100% attendance, where the agenda items of the Extraordinary General Assembly were approved.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Issa Abdul Latif Al-Enezi <orig>عيسى عبداللطيف العنزي</orig> – authorized by the shareholders – and attended by Mr. Bandar Al-Huwaiss <orig>بندر الهويس</orig> – representative of Gulf Securities Depository Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
The agenda items of the Extraordinary General Assembly were approved as follows:
**First: Company's Articles of Association:**
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (1) of the Company's Articles of Association.
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** The preamble is an integral part of this contract, and it consists of the signatories to this contract as a group whose purpose is to establish a Kuwaiti shareholding company with a license from the Kuwaiti government, in accordance with the provisions of Commercial Companies Law No. (15) of 1960 <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية رقم (15) لسنة 1960</orig>, the amended laws, and the bylaws attached to this contract.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The preamble is an integral part of this contract, and it consists of the signatories to this contract as a group whose purpose is to establish a Kuwaiti shareholding company with a license from the Kuwaiti government, in accordance with the provisions of Commercial Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig>, the amended laws, and the bylaws attached to this contract.
Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (5) of the Company's Articles of Association.
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** Amendment of Article No. (5) of the Articles of Incorporation and Article No. (4) of the Bylaws.
**The purposes for which the company was established are as follows:**
1.  Production of car bodies, containers, and roofing (Quick Span or Super Span) <orig>كويك سبان أو سوبر سبان</orig>, and all works related to the iron industry, prefabricated houses, and chalets (sandwich panels) <orig>سندويتش بانل</orig>.

# Article 48 of the Bylaws After Amendment
. Subject to the provisions contained in the company's articles of association, the Ordinary General Assembly may, upon the proposal of the Board of Directors, distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year or the end of each financial period. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from real profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the company's paid-up capital.
# Article 49 of the Bylaws Before Amendment
. The reserve fund shall be used by a decision of the Board of Directors in what best serves the company's interests. The mandatory reserve may not be distributed to shareholders, but it may be used to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders up to (5%) five percent in years when the company's profits do not allow for this limit. If the mandatory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital, the General Assembly may decide to use the excess for purposes it deems beneficial to the company and its shareholders.
# Article 49 of the Bylaws After Amendment
. A percentage, determined by the company's articles of association or the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, shall be deducted annually from the gross profits for the depreciation of the company's assets or compensation for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
. The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws.
. The company's articles of association may stipulate the establishment of a special fund to assist the company's workers and employees.
. Annually, by a decision issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve allocated for purposes determined by the General Assembly.
# Article (52) of the Company's Bylaws Before Amendment
The company's liquidation shall be carried out as stipulated in the provisions of the articles of Companies Law No. 25 of 2012 <orig>قانون الشركات 25 لسنة 2012</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
# Article (52) of the Bylaws After Amendment
Upon its dissolution, the company shall enter the liquidation phase. During the liquidation period, the company shall retain its legal personality to the extent necessary to complete the liquidation. The phrase "Under Liquidation" <orig>تحت التصفية</orig> must be clearly added to the company's name in all its correspondence.
The liquidation of the company shall follow the provisions stipulated in the following articles, unless otherwise provided in the company's articles of association.
# Article 53 of the Bylaws Before Amendment
The provisions of Companies Law No. 25 of 2012 <orig>الشركات رقم 25 لسنة 2012</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the articles of incorporation or in these bylaws.
# Article 53 of the Bylaws After Amendment
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the articles of incorporation or in these bylaws.
The meeting concluded at 12:00 PM, and all the aforementioned amendments were approved.
