2. Members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> undertake to maintain the confidentiality of data and information that has come to their knowledge by virtue of their position on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. No person who has a representative on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig>, or any member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or any member of the Executive Management <orig>الإدارة التنفيذية</orig>, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.
3. Members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they have become aware of due to their management of the company. Otherwise, they shall be dismissed and held liable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.
4. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or any member of the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for his own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to demand compensation from him or to consider the operations he carried out for his own account as if they were conducted for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.
5. A member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may dispose of his shares during his membership on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the law, the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>, or these bylaws <orig>النظام</orig>.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (19) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman <orig>رئيسا</orig> and a Vice-Chairman <orig>نائبا للرئيس</orig> for three years, provided that this period does not exceed their term of membership on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall represent the company before the judiciary and third parties, and shall implement the resolutions issued by the Board <orig>المجلس</orig>. The Vice-Chairman <orig>نائب الرئيس</orig> shall perform the duties of the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> in his absence or if there is an impediment.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman of the Board <orig>رئيسا للمجلس</orig> and a Vice-Chairman <orig>نائبا للرئيس</orig>. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other powers specified in the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in the company's relations with third parties. He shall implement the Board's <orig>المجلس</orig> resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman <orig>نائب الرئيس</orig> shall replace the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> in his absence or if there is an impediment preventing him from exercising his powers.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (20) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may appoint one or more managing directors <orig>عضوا منتدبا للإدارة</orig> from among its members, and the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> shall determine their powers and remunerations. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may appoint a General Manager <orig>مديرا عاما</orig> for the company and determine his powers and remunerations.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The company may have one or more Chief Executive Officers <orig>رئيسا تنفيذيا</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from among its members or from others, entrusted with the management of the company. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> shall determine their allowances and their signing authorities on behalf of the company. It is permissible to combine the positions of Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (21) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** The right to sign on behalf of the company individually shall be held by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or his Vice-Chairman <orig>نائبه</orig>, and the managing members of the Board of Directors <orig>اعضاء مجلس الإدارة المنتدبين</orig> according to the powers specified for them by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or any other member authorized by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for this purpose.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may also delegate one of its members, or a committee from among its members or from third parties, to carry out one or more specific tasks, or to supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or to exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board <orig>المجلس</orig>.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (22) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall meet at least four times during the financial year upon an invitation from its Chairman <orig>رئيسه</orig>. It shall also meet if requested by at least two of its members. A Board <orig>المجلس</orig> meeting shall be valid with the attendance of the majority of its members. Attendance by proxy or by circulation is not permitted in Board <orig>المجلس</orig> meetings.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall meet at least six times during the year, unless the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> stipulate more frequent meetings. A Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meeting shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. Meetings can be held using modern communication means, and decisions may be taken by circulation with the approval of all Board <orig>المجلس</orig> members. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must meet at least six times.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (23) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** Resolutions of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be issued by a majority of those present. If votes are tied, the side on which the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> is shall prevail. A special register shall be kept in which the minutes of the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> meetings are recorded and signed by the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig>. A dissenting member may request that his opinion be recorded.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** Resolutions of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be issued by a majority of those present. If votes are tied, the side on which the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> is shall prevail. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall appoint a Secretary <orig>أمين سر</orig> who shall record all proceedings of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings in minutes. A special register shall be kept in which these minutes are recorded. The minutes of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be signed by the Board Secretary <orig>أمين السر المجلس</orig> and all attending members. A dissenting member may request that his opinion be recorded in the meeting minutes.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (24) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** If a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to attend three consecutive sessions without a legitimate excuse, he may be considered resigned by a resolution of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** If a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to attend four consecutive sessions without a legitimate excuse, he may be considered resigned by a resolution of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (25) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** Without prejudice to the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall determine the remuneration of the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The remuneration of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not exceed a total of more than ten percent of the company's net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than five percent of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon). An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and each member of the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> from the date of the company's establishment until profits are achieved that allow for the distribution of remunerations in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a resolution issued by the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, a resigning board member may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration (if the company has independent members). The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is obligated to submit an annual report to be presented to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> for approval, detailing the amounts and benefits received by the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (26) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall have the broadest powers to manage the company and carry out all actions required for the company's management in accordance with its purposes. This authority is limited only by what is stipulated in the law, these bylaws <orig>النظام</orig>, or the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not sell or mortgage the company's real estate, issue guarantees, or conclude loans except after the approval of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall have the broadest powers to manage the company and carry out all actions required for the company's management in accordance with its purposes. This authority is limited only by what is stipulated in the law, these bylaws <orig>النظام</orig>, or the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may sell or mortgage the company's real estate, issue guarantees, conclude loans, or engage in reconciliation <orig>الصلح</orig>, arbitration <orig>التحكيم</orig>, or donations <orig>التبرعات</orig>.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (28) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and its members are responsible for their actions towards

**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and its members are responsible for their actions towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of authority, and for any violation of the provisions of the law, or the company's articles of association, and for errors in management. ## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (29) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** The General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> shall convene at least once a year at the place and time specified by the company's regulations. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall call for this assembly whenever it deems necessary. The Board must call for it whenever requested by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-tenth of the capital. The invitation to attend the meeting, including a clear summary of the agenda, shall be sent by one of the following two methods:
1.  Registered letters sent to all shareholders at least one week before the scheduled date of its convening.
2.  An announcement in at least two daily newspapers published in Arabic. The announcement must be made twice, provided that the second announcement is made after a period of no less than one week from the date of publication of the first announcement and at least one week before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> convenes, with the second announcement published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in addition to the two daily newspapers. The invitation must include the agenda. The founders shall set the agenda for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> convened in its founding capacity, and the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall set the agenda for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> convened in its ordinary and extraordinary capacities.

**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The invitation to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1.  Registered letters sent to all shareholders at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2.  An announcement, which must be made at least twice, provided that the second announcement is made after a period of no less than seven days from the date of publication of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting convenes.
3.  Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4.  Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.

The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening, for the attendance of a Ministry representative. The absence of a Ministry representative after notification does not invalidate the meeting.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (30) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** In cases where the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may be convened at the request of shareholders, auditors, or the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, the agenda shall be set by those requesting the convening of the assembly. No matter not included in the agenda may be discussed.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the preparation of the agendas or were revealed during the meeting, or if requested by one of the supervisory bodies, the auditor, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders owning one-quarter of the issued share capital. The postponed meeting shall convene without the need for new invitation procedures.

## Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (31) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**Text of the Article Before Amendment:** Each shareholder shall have a number of votes equal to the number of their shares. Proxy representation is permitted for attending the meeting. Minors and those legally interdicted shall be represented by their legal guardians. No member may participate in voting on behalf of themselves or their legal representative in matters related to a special benefit for them or a conflict existing between them and the company.
**Text of the Article After Amendment:** Every shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote on behalf of themselves or their representative in matters related to a special benefit for them, or a conflict existing between them and the company. Any condition or resolution that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may

Text of the Article After Amendment: The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall submit to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> a report containing a statement on the company's operations, its financial and economic status, the company's budget, a statement of profit and loss accounts, a statement on the remuneration of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, the fees of auditors, and a proposal for profit distribution in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (39) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
### Text of the Article Before Amendment:
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> convened in an ordinary session shall discuss the report of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and decide what it deems appropriate regarding it, consider the report of the auditors and the report of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, if any. It shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and appoint the auditors for the coming year and determine their fees in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>.
### Text of the Article After Amendment:
Subject to the provisions of the law, the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> in its annual meeting shall be competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1. The report of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> on the company's activity and financial position for the ended financial year.
2. The auditor's report for the ended financial year.
3. A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. Proposals of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> regarding profit distribution.
6. Discharging the liability of the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7. Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and determining their remuneration.
8. Appointing an auditor for the company, and determining their fees or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9. A report on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties in accordance with International Accounting Standards.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (40) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
### Text of the Article Before Amendment:
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall convene in an extraordinary session upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a request from shareholders owning no less than a quarter of the company's shares. In this case, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Assembly within one month from the date the request is received.
### Text of the Article After Amendment:
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a reasoned request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request. If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the expiry date referred to in the preceding paragraph.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (41) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
### Text of the Article Before Amendment:
The following matters shall only be considered by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة المنعقدة بصفة غير عادية</orig>:
1. Amending the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of the company.
2. Selling the entire project undertaken by the company or disposing of it in any other way.
3. Dissolving the company or merging it into another company or entity.
4. Reducing the company's capital.
Any amendment to the company's regulations shall not be effective except after the approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
### Text of the Article After Amendment:
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent for the following matters:
1. Amending the company's Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2. Selling the entire project undertaken by the company or disposing of it in any other way.
3. Dissolving the company, or its merger, transformation, or division.
4. Increasing or reducing the company's capital.
- Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until the publication procedures are completed. The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, its purposes, or its capital, with the exception of increasing capital by issuing shares against profits achieved by the company or as a result of adding reserves, which the holder is entitled to use, to the capital.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (42) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
### Text of the Article Before Amendment:
The company shall have one or more auditors from among chartered accountants, appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, which shall determine their fees. The auditor shall monitor the accounts of the financial year for which they were appointed.
### Text of the Article After Amendment:
The company shall have one or more auditors appointed by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>. In exceptional and urgent cases where the auditor appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> does not perform their duties for any reason, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may appoint a replacement, provided that this matter is presented at the first meeting held by the Assembly for decision.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (46) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
### Text of the Article Before Amendment:
A percentage determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be deducted from the gross non-net profits for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
### Text of the Article After Amendment:
A percentage determined by the company's Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> or the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, after consulting the auditor, shall be deducted from the gross non-net profits for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (47) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
### Text of the Article Before Amendment:
The net profits shall be distributed as follows:
1. Ten percent (10%) shall be deducted and allocated to the statutory reserve account, unless the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> specify a higher percentage. The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on 14/05/2025

The General Assembly of Shareholders of Al-Mawazi Capital Company <orig>شركة الموازي كابيتال</orig> – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) – held its Extraordinary Meeting at 10:00 AM on Wednesday, 14/05/2025, at the company's headquarters located on Mohammed Thunayan Al-Ghanim Street <orig>شارع محمد ثنيان الغانم</orig> – Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> – Al-Sahab Tower <orig>برج السحاب</orig> – 15th Floor.
The meeting session was chaired by Mr. Muhannad Mohammed Al-Sanea <orig>مهند محمد الصانع</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer. The following also attended this meeting:
- Shareholders holding 15,000,000 shares in person, representing 100% of the total capital shares amounting to KWD 1,500,000 <orig>1,500,000 د.ك</orig>.
- Ms. Zeina Mohammed Azzam <orig>زينة محمد عزام</orig> – Company Secretary.
After the announcement of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, Mr. Muhannad Mohammed Al-Sanea <orig>مهند محمد الصانع</orig> opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees. Subsequently, the agenda items were discussed, and decisions were taken as follows:
1. Approval was granted for the amendment of Article No. (6) in the Memorandum of Association and Article No. (4) of the Articles of Association by adding a new commercial activity: "Securities-Based Crowdfunding Platform Service," according to the details mentioned below:
Activity Name: Securities-Based Crowdfunding Platform Service.
International Code: 650302
Sector: (64-66) – Financial Activities, Insurance Activities, and Related Services
After reviewing the observations of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, approval was granted for the deletion of the following activities:
1. Owning and managing websites and electronic applications that fall within the company's objectives.
2. Managing its subsidiaries, participating in the management of companies in which it holds shares, and providing necessary support to them.
3. Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, trade logos, or industrial drawings, or any related moral and financial rights, and leasing or investing them for other companies to exploit, whether inside or outside Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>.
The text after the amendment shall be as follows:

The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover company losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of a voluntary reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
Any amount deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be restored to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
Secondly: One percent (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
Thirdly: Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form a voluntary reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.
Fourthly: The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of profits to meet the company's obligations under labor laws and social insurance laws, and a special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.
Fifthly: After the foregoing, an amount determined by the Ordinary General Assembly, not exceeding 10% (ten percent) of the remainder, shall be deducted and allocated as remuneration for the Board of Directors, and a higher percentage may be agreed upon.
Sixthly: The General Assembly, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, may distribute dividends to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year, provided that for the validity of this distribution, it must be from actual profits and in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital.
Approval of the amendment of Article No. (49) of the Articles of Association
Text of the Article Before Amendment: The reserve fund <orig>المال الاحتياطي</orig> shall be used by a decision of the Board of Directors for the benefit of the company. The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may not be distributed to shareholders, but it may be used to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders up to five percent (5%) in years when the company's profits do not allow for this limit. If the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's capital, the Assembly may decide to use the excess for purposes it deems beneficial to the company and its shareholders.
Text of the Article After Amendment:
The amount necessary for the distribution of a five percent share of profits to shareholders shall be deducted, as determined by the Board of Directors and approved by the General Assembly.
Approval of the amendment of Article No. (51) of the Articles of Association
Text of the Article Before Amendment: The company shall be dissolved for one of the reasons stipulated in the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>.
Text of the Article After Amendment:
The company shall be dissolved for one of the reasons stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations.
Approval of the amendment of Article No. (52) of the Articles of Association
Text of the Article Before Amendment: The liquidation of the company's assets upon its dissolution shall be carried out in accordance with the provisions contained in the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>.
Text of the Article After Amendment:
The liquidation of the company's assets upon its dissolution shall be carried out in accordance with the provisions contained in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations.
Approval of the amendment of Article No. (53) of the Articles of Association
Text of the Article Before Amendment: The provisions of Commercial Companies Law No. 15 of 1960 <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية رقم 15 لسنة 1960</orig> and its amendments shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the Memorandum of Association or these Articles.
Text of the Article After Amendment:
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the Memorandum of Association or these Articles.

At the conclusion of the meeting, Mr. Muhannad Mohammed Al-Sanea <orig>مهند محمد الصانع</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer – thanked the attendees, and the proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting concluded at 10:30 AM on the same day.

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on 11/05/2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> K.S.C.C. (Closed) was held on Sunday, 11/05/2025, at 11:00 AM at the company's headquarters located in Sharq Area <orig>منطقة الشرق</orig> - Ahmed Al-Jaber Street <orig>شارع أحمد الجابر</orig> - Gravity Tower <orig>برج جرافيتي</orig> - 13th Floor.
The meeting session was chaired by Mr. Eid Salman Matar Al-Shammari <orig>عيد سلمان مطر الشمري</orig> - Chairman of the Board of Directors.
Also present at the meeting were:
- Mr. Hussein Ali Al-Hadi Abu Al-Fotouh <orig>حسين علي الهادي أبو الفتوح</orig> - Board Secretary.
- Shareholders holding 42,000,000 original shares, representing 84% of the total share capital of the company, which amounts to 50,000,000 shares.
After the announcement of the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the Session <orig>رئيس الجلسة</orig> opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees, and proceeded to present and discuss the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly at the time of approving and ratifying them, which are as follows:
First: Approval of amending the text of Article No. (14) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> as follows:
Text before amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) members elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot.
Text after amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of five members, and the number of independent board members shall not be less than two and shall not exceed half of the total board members.
Second: Approval of amending the text of Article No. (15) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> as follows:
Text before amendment:
The term of membership of the Board of Directors is three years, renewable.
Text after amendment:
The term of membership of the Board of Directors is three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board of Directors is elected.
Third: Approval of amending the text of Article No. (16) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> as follows:
Text before amendment:
A member of the Board of Directors must not have been convicted of a crime against honor and must own shares in the company not less than 1% of the company's capital, provided that it is sufficient for the member to own shares equivalent in value to seven thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. All of this is unless the company's regulations stipulate otherwise. This amount of shares is allocated to guarantee the member's management, and must be deposited within one month from the date of the member's appointment in accredited banks, and shall remain deposited and non-tradable until the end of the membership term and the approval of the financial statements for the last fiscal year in which the member performed their duties. If the member does not provide the guarantee as mentioned, their membership shall be void.
Text after amendment:
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership of the Board of Directors:
1- Must possess legal capacity to act.
2- Must not have been previously convicted of a felony involving deprivation of liberty, a crime of negligent or fraudulent bankruptcy, a crime against honor or trust, or a penalty restricting liberty due to violation of the provisions of this law, unless their reputation has been restored.
3- Except for independent board members, must personally own or the person they represent must own a number of shares in the company. If a board member loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease.
Accordingly, at the end of the meeting, the Chairman of the Session <orig>رئيس الجلسة</orig> extended his sincere thanks to the attendees, wishing them and the company success. The meeting concluded at 12:00 PM on the same day.

Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chairman of the Meeting

Oron Cinema Company <orig>شركة اورون للسينما</orig> (K.S.C.C.) Closed
Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Sunday, 11/05/2025 AD, at 12:30 PM, the meeting was held with the presence of both Mr. Ali Mohammed Ali Al-Dukhan <orig>علي محمد علي الدخان</orig> and Mr. Nasser Saud Al-Manea <orig>ناصر سعود المنيع</orig> (representative of Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>) via ZOOM program.
The quorum percentage reached 90.00%, and the following was done:
First: Approval was given to amend Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>.

Activities before amendment
1. Management and ownership of cinemas in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, their operation and exploitation, import, export, rental, sale, production, and distribution of films of all types and sizes.
2. Import of all necessary machinery and equipment for the cinema industry, and trading in them, as well as in raw films, photographic equipment, display equipment, and furniture, and generally everything that may be included or used for the cinema industry.
3. Participation in all governmental or private tenders that fall within its objectives.
4. Has the right to agree with theatrical, musical, and entertainment troupes inside and outside Kuwait to hold parties, provided that their presence does not conflict with the country's laws and regulations.
5. Renting cinemas to governmental and private entities, and by effort, to hold parties.
6. The company specializes generally in everything related to cinema and its accessories, including aspects of culture, entertainment, and intellectual activity in Kuwait and abroad.
7. Utilizing the financial surpluses available to the company by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities (after obtaining the approval of the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>). The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.

Third: Approval of amending Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> (for the company's purposes) as follows:
Text before amendment:
Without prejudice to the provisions of Decree-Law No. 1/2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> concerning Companies and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1. Buying and selling land and real estate, and managing, leasing, and renting real estate.
2. Buying and selling shares, bonds, and securities of real estate companies for the company's account.
3. Utilizing the company's financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
4. Preparing studies and providing consultations in all types of real estate fields, provided that the required conditions are met by those who provide this service.
5. Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's projects and holding real estate auctions according to the Ministry's regulations.
6. Owning and managing commercial markets and residential complexes.
7. Direct contribution to establishing the infrastructure for residential, commercial, and industrial areas.
8. Owning, selling, buying, and developing real estate and land for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, as well as managing third-party properties, all in a manner that does not violate the provisions stipulated in existing laws and what they have prohibited regarding trading in private residential plots as stipulated by these laws.
9. Owning and managing hotels, health clubs, and tourist facilities, and leasing and renting them.
10. Carrying out various maintenance works for buildings and real estate owned by the company and third parties, including maintenance works and the execution of civil, mechanical, electrical, elevator, and air conditioning works, ensuring the preservation and safety of the buildings.
11. Managing, operating, renting, leasing, and exploiting hotels, clubs, motels, guesthouses, rest areas, parks, gardens, exhibitions, restaurants, cafes, cafeterias, residential complexes, tourist and health resorts, recreational and sports projects, and halls, at various grades and levels, including all original and auxiliary services, attached facilities, and other necessary services.
The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait and abroad, and it may acquire or merge with such entities.
Text after amendment:
Without prejudice to the provisions of Decree-Law No. 1/2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> concerning Companies and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1. Holding company activities (642000).
2. Managing its subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares and providing necessary support to them (642010).
3. Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities (642020).
4. Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for conducting its business within the limits permitted by law (642030).
5. Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent (642040).
6. Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies and others (642050).
7. Business management office for holding activities (642070).
The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait and abroad, and it may acquire or merge with such entities.
This item was approved by all shareholders present, both by direct attendance and through electronic voting.

2. Amending Article (6) of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (5) of the Company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> (Company Capital) to read as follows:
**Text before amendment:**

This item was approved by all shareholders present, both in person and through electronic voting.

Fifth: Approval of the amendment to Article (37) of the Company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> as follows:
**Text before amendment:**
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> at its annual meeting is competent to make decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3. A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6. Discharging the liability of the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members.
7. Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and determining their remuneration.
8. Appointing the company's auditor, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9. The report of the Fatwa and Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الفتوى والرقابة الشرعية</orig> on the company's compliance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>.
10. Appointing the Fatwa and Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الفتوى والرقابة الشرعية</orig>, determining the fees of its members, or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
Report on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties, where related parties are defined according to International Accounting Standards.
This item was approved by all shareholders present, both in person and through electronic voting.

Sixth: Approval of adding new articles to the Company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> as follows:
1. Approval of adding Article No. (59) to the Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, which stipulates the following:
The purposes for which the company was established must be practiced in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>. Under no circumstances shall any of the purposes stated in Article (5) of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article No. (4) of the Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> be interpreted as permitting the company to directly engage in any usurious activities or activities contrary to the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>.
2. Approval of adding Article No. (60) to the Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, which stipulates the following:
The company shall form an independent body called the (Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig>), consisting of at least three specialists in the principles of Islamic jurisprudence <orig>أصول الفقه الإسلامي</orig> holding at least a university degree in this field, appointed by the Company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
Its competencies include:
- Providing Islamic Sharia <orig>الشرعي الإسلامي</orig> opinions on the company's activities and actions.
- Verifying the company's compliance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>.
- Submitting an annual report to the Company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> that includes its opinion on the extent of the company's operations, activities, and actions' compliance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>, the extent of the company's management's adherence to the opinions expressed by the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> in this regard, and any observations it may have on the company's operations.
This report shall be included in the company's annual report.
Opinions shall be taken by majority. In the event that a majority cannot be achieved and there is a disagreement among the members of the Sharia Board <orig>الهيئة الشرعية</orig> regarding a Sharia ruling, the disputed matter shall be referred to the Fatwa Department <orig>هيئة الفتوى</orig> at the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الأوقاف والشئون الإسلامية</orig>.
This item was approved by all shareholders present, both in person and through electronic voting.
The meeting concluded at 10:20 AM.

**Noor Financial Investment Company <orig>شركة نور للاستثمار المالي</orig> (K.S.C.P.) Public**
**Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting**

The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Noor Financial Investment Company <orig>شركة نور للاستثمار المالي</orig> K.S.C.P. (Public) was held on Monday, May 19, 2025, at 11:00 AM, at the company's headquarters located in Al-Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> area - intersection of Al-Jahra Street <orig>شارع الجهراء</orig> with Airport Road, Noor Building, next to National Industries Group Holding <orig>مجموعة الصناعات الوطنية القابضة</orig>.

The meeting session was chaired by Mr. Riad Salem Ali Idris <orig>رياض سالم علي إدريس</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors.

Also present was Mr. Mohammed Nasser Al-Subaie <orig>محمد ناصر السبيعي</orig> – Representative of Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.

The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> was notified of the agenda, date, and venue of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting by letter dated April 23, 2025, in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig>.

Shareholders holding 394,434,885 shares by proxy attended, representing 77.458% (after excluding treasury shares totaling 7,230,797 shares) of the company's total shares of 516,453,451 shares, as follows:

After the announcement that the legal quorum required for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting had been met, Mr. Riad Salem Ali Idris <orig>رياض سالم علي إدريس</orig> – Chairman of the Assembly, opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. The Extraordinary General Assembly then discussed the items on its agenda successively as follows:

**First:** Approval was granted for the amendment of Article No. 5 (amended) of the Articles of Association and Article No. 4 (amended) of the Company's Memorandum of Incorporation, as follows:

**Text Before Amendment:**
Carrying out all financial investment operations in all economic sectors inside and outside Kuwait, for its own account and for the account of others, including:
-1 Investing in various economic sectors by contributing to the establishment of specialized companies or purchasing shares or stakes in such companies.
-2 Investment portfolio manager.
-3 Financing and brokerage in international trade operations.
-4 Collective investment scheme manager.
-5 Underwriter.
-6 Performing all services and activities that help develop the financial and monetary market in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
-7 Trading (buying and selling) in shares, bonds, financial sukuk, and other securities listed on the Kuwait Stock Exchange <orig>سوق الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> and foreign stock markets, for the company's account only.
-8 Investing in real estate, industrial, and agricultural sectors of the economy in all forms of investment.

**Kuwaiti Family Office for Investment Consulting <orig>شركة مكتب العائلة الكويتية للاستشارات الاستثمارية</orig> W.L.L.**
**Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting**
**Held on Sunday, May 04, 2025**

Based on Board of Directors Meeting No. 2/2024 held on December 02, 2024, and the invitation issued by the Chairman of the Board of Directors to attend the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting to discuss the agenda items, the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting was held on Sunday, May 04, 2025, at 9:00 AM via the electronic system, after voting opened on Thursday, April 24, 2025, through the electronic system of Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>. Shareholders representing 9,900,000 shares, both in person and by proxy, attended, constituting 99% of the company's total capital of K.D. 1,000,000,000 <orig>1,000,000,000 دينار كويتي</orig>. The completion of the necessary quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting was announced, followed by the recitation of the agenda items for discussion. The Extraordinary General Assembly issued its approval regarding the following resolutions:

**Item One:** – Voting on the amendment of Article 27 of the Company's Articles of Association (Board of Directors) according to the following wording:

**Text Before Amendment:**
Article 27- A- Board of Directors – The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (6) members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected.

**Text After Amendment:**
Article 27- A- Board of Directors – The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of five (5) members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected.

**Item Two:** – Voting on the amendment of Article 33 of the Company's Articles of Association.

**Text Before Amendment:**
A Board of Directors meeting shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than four. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon, and meetings may be held using modern communication methods, with decisions taken by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

Net profits shall be distributed as follows:
1 - Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of no less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company. The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's issued capital. The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital <orig>رأس المال المدفوع</orig> in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits. What has been deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.

Announcement
Re-issuance of Practice No.: 2411-10-16259
Regarding the purchase of hoses and pipes
The Ministry of Defense / Wizarat Al-Difa' <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig> announces the re-issuance of the aforementioned practice to specialized companies for the year 2025, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Technical Equipment Department / Idarat Al-Tajhizat Al-Fanniya <orig>إدارة التجهيزات الفنية</orig> - Technical Equipment Control / Muraqabat Al-Tajhizat Al-Fanniya <orig>مراقبة التجهيزات الفنية</orig> - during official working hours. Bids must be submitted at the Ministry's headquarters at 12:00 PM - Mail and Tenders Delivery Center near Gate No. (12) of the Military Procurement Committee / Lajnat Al-Mushtariyat Al-Askariya <orig>لجنة المشتريات العسكرية</orig> (Box No. 3) before the closing date.

|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| K.D. 75/- (K-NET <orig>كي نت</orig> only) | Sunday, 26/05/2025 | Sunday, 26/05/2025 | K.D. 272/000 (Validity period: 90 days starting after bid opening) (2% of bid value) |

Companies wishing to participate in the practice must:
1/ Submit a letter of authorization from the company to purchase the practice documents.
2/ The company/establishment must be specialized in this field, provide documents proving its activity, and be registered with the Ministry.
3/ Submit a copy of the annual national labor support certificate for non-governmental companies, provided it is valid.
4/ Pay the prescribed fees for purchasing practice documents via K-NET <orig>كي نت</orig>.
5/ Submit an official letter for any inquiries within (one week) from the date of publication of the announcement.

Announcement
Ministry of Health / Wizarat Al-Sihha <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
The Ministry of Health / Wizarat Al-Sihha <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No.: S / MS / 2026/2025
Regarding the supply of television screens for operating the IPTV system for the New Kuwait Cancer Center / Markaz Al-Kuwait Lil-Saratan Al-Jadid <orig>مركز الكويت للسرطان الجديد</orig>.
The Ministry of Health / Wizarat Al-Sihha <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. S / MS / 2026/2025 regarding the supply of television screens for operating the IPTV system for the New Kuwait Cancer Center / Markaz Al-Kuwait Lil-Saratan Al-Jadid <orig>مركز الكويت للسرطان الجديد</orig>, in accordance with the general and special conditions specified in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw), for a non-refundable fee of K.D. 75/- (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars only).
It is necessary to attach a letter from the Public Authority for Manpower / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma Lil-Quwa Al-Amila <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> when submitting the booklet, stating compliance with the National Labor Support Law / Qanun Da'm Al-Amala Al-Wataniya <orig>قانون دعم العمالة الوطنية</orig> in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and Council of Ministers / Majlis Al-Wuzara' <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Resolution No. 1104 (Fifth) of 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.
Please note that the closing date for the practice is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 23/06/2025, at the bids box in the Ministry of Health / Wizarat Al-Sihha <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> Headquarters (Sulaibikhat / Al-Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبخات</orig> – Ministry of Health Building – First Floor – Procurement Department / Idarat Al-Mushtariyat <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> – Practices Section / Qism Al-Mumarasat <orig>قسم الممارسات</orig>). Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, and the initial guarantee is (2%) only, two percent of the bid value, valid throughout the bid's validity period.
Note: Priority is given to owners of small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development / Al-Sunduq Al-Watani wa Tanmiyat Al-Mashru'at Al-Saghira wal-Mutawassita <orig>الصندوق الوطني وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>.

Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> in its Session
No. 13 held on 27/04/2025

After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in birth and death records, the committee decided to make the amendment listed below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 69/36 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 2021/1650, met.
*   Mr. / Director of the Central Registry Department for Births and Deaths <orig>مدير إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig>
*   Mr. / Head of Research and Opinion Section <orig>رئيس قسم البحوث والرأي</orig>
*   Mr. / Head of Deaths Section <orig>رئيس قسم الوفيات</orig>
*   Mr. / Head of Records Section <orig>رئيس قسم السجلات</orig>
*   Ms. Alia Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig> performed the duties of the Committee Secretary.

The committee reviewed requests from No. (171) to No. (186) in the attached list concerning the amendment of data in birth and death records, including requests for omitted birth and death registrations. After its review and verification of the completeness of documents and records, the committee decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If, after the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of publication of this announcement, no objection is submitted to the amendments in the registers, birth and death certificates will be issued.

# Announcement of Property Sale by Public Auction

Secondly: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall commence at the basic price of (KWD 750,000) seven hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges having inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner resides in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."
4- Director General of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>, in his capacity.
5- Director of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig>, in his capacity.
6- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, in his capacity.
Property Description: As stated in the Municipality's <orig>البلدية</orig> property description certificate.
An undivided share <orig>حصة مشاعاً</orig> of 50% of residential unit No. 2, Model 1 - Second Floor, with a total area of 161.349 m², and property document No. 2019/4026, located in the North West Sulaibikhat <orig>شمال غرب الصليبيخات</orig> area - Plot No. (3) (39120-) Parcel 8, by public auction with a basic price of KWD 99,000 (ninety-nine thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) for the offered share.
** According to the expert's report on the property subject of the lawsuit, located in the North West Sulaibikhat <orig>شمال غرب الصليبيخات</orig> area - Plot (3), Street (301) - Building (8), bearing automated number 94165729, in the presence and guidance of the second defendant and his agent, the plaintiff and her agent, a representative of Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, a representative of Minors' Affairs <orig>شؤون القصر</orig>, and an enforcement representative, despite proper notification, and the presence of Mr. Tareq Al-Moajel <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, the expert, I conducted the inspection as follows:
The property containing the subject of the lawsuit is a residential building consisting of (5) repeated floors. The building is a corner unit, overlooking a side plaza, a main street, and a secondary street.
The property has (2) electric elevators.
The exterior cladding of the property is Sigma in beige and pink.
The disputed property subject of the lawsuit is the apartment located on the second floor of the building and occupies the entire second floor.
The apartment subject of the dispute conforms to the general and specific specifications of document No. 2019/4026, has an area of 161.349 square meters, and the disputed apartment bears automated number 20475396.
The apartment consists of (4) rooms, one master bedroom, (5) bathrooms, a kitchen, a living room, a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, a balcony, and a maid's room with its bathroom.
- The floors of the disputed apartment are ceramic, the air conditioning is central, and its construction and finishing are new.
- The second defendant stated that he is the possessor of the disputed apartment and uses it with his children, and that the disputed apartment does not generate income.
Together with Mr. Tareq Al-Moajel <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, the expert, we inspected the disputed apartment on site. Mr. Tareq Al-Moajel <orig>طارق المعجل</orig> collected specific data about the apartment in preparation for estimating the value of the existing buildings and structures on its land, along with estimating the value of the land itself, to determine the total value of the property, land and buildings.

The disputed property is located in Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area, Block 5 <orig>5</orig>, Street 10 <orig>10</orig>, House 13 <orig>13</orig> at the time of inspection, as follows:
The property subject of the lawsuit is a government house, conforming in terms of general and specific specifications to document number 1999/4722 <orig>1999/4722</orig>, with an area of 400m2.

## Secondly: Auction Conditions:
*   **First:** The auction shall commence at the base price indicated in the expert's decision. Participation in the auction requires depositing at least one-fifth of that price by means of a certified check from the drawee bank or by means of a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
*   **Second:** The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
*   **Third:** If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
*   **Fourth:** If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, provided that the full auction price is deposited. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
*   **Fifth:** If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
*   **Sixth:** In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transferring and registering ownership, as well as the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
*   **Seventh:** This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those directly involved in the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
*   **Eighth:** The successful bidder acknowledges having inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price specified for each property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

## Secondly: Auction Terms:

Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.

Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.

Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.

Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.

Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and bidders are requested for the sale procedures at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall rent it by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent".

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale had been awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. The parties initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Note: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."
President of the Court of First Instance

3- The appraisal expert stated that he could estimate the value of the property (land and building) from the outside. Accordingly, the property was inspected from the outside, but he was unable to estimate the value of the yield as he could not inspect the property's components.
