Athari Mohammed Khalaf Al-Dhafiri <orig>عذاري محمد خلف الظفيري</orig> on her own behalf and as guardian of her children, heirs of / Abdulkarim Abdulaziz Ali Abel <orig>عبدالكريم عبدالعزيز علي أبل</orig>, namely Abdulaziz <orig>عبدالعزيز</orig>, Ali <orig>علي</orig>, Rayyan <orig>ريان</orig>, Ramas <orig>رماس</orig>, Reem <orig>ريم</orig>, and Manayer <orig>مناير</orig>.
Against:
1- Bader Abdulaziz Ali Abel <orig>بدر عبدالعزيز علي أبل</orig>.
2- Angy Jawdat Toker <orig>أنجي جودت توكر</orig>.
3- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> for Real Estate Registration and Authentication Affairs, in his capacity.

Firstly: Property Description:
Property of Document No. 2020/6576 located in Abdullah Al-Salem <orig>عبدالله السالم</orig> District – Plot No. 2 – Parcel 20 – Plan M / 25729 – with an area of 1000 m².
Inspection:
On 25/5/2022, the expert moved to the disputed property located in Abdullah Al-Salem <orig>عبدالله السالم</orig> area, Plot 2, Street 21, Parcel 20, House 11, Automated Number 10412594, in the presence and guidance of the plaintiff in person, with the defendants or their representatives failing to attend, and in the presence of Mr. Due Diligence Expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> / Khalid Al-Jariwi <orig>خالد الجريوي</orig>. The inspection was carried out as follows:
1- The expert knocked on the door, but no one opened it, as the plaintiff stated that the property was in the possession of the first defendant.
2- The expert inspected the property from the outside, which is a parcel overlooking two streets (front and back), an internal street and a public street (Maghreb Road), with a setback and a courtyard, and an area of 1000 m².
3- The plaintiff stated that the property consists of a basement (half the property), a ground floor, and a first floor.
4- The property is clad with stone and tiles.

Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at a base price of 2,025,000 K.D. (Two Million and Twenty-Five Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of one-fifth of the price drawn, or by means of a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding shall be reopened at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session, and no bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value.
The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the transfer and property registration fees, expenses, enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement.

Property Description: As stated in the Municipality's <orig>البلدية</orig> property description certificate.
- Property Document No. 2009/2369, with an area of 278.92 m² – Plot No. 41 – Block No. 36923 – Al-Dhaher <orig>الظهر</orig> Area – 2, by public auction with a base price of 222,750 K.D. (Two Hundred Twenty-Two Thousand Seven Hundred Fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
Remarks: After inspecting the property, it was found to be a private residence consisting of a ground floor, first floor, and a roof. Violations were found where the owner encroached towards the street by an area of 27.2 square meters on the ground floor and 39.44 square meters on the first floor, with no building permit. There is also a full encroachment on the first floor towards the neighbor. There is a licensed construction on the ground floor roof with an area of 5.29 square meters at the back, and an unlicensed construction on the ground floor with an area of 5.29 square meters at the back.
** And according to the expert's report regarding the disputed property located in Al-Dhaher <orig>الظهر</orig> Area – Block 2 – Street 3 – Avenue 21 – House 41 – Document 1 – Automated Address Number 91057749 at the time of inspection, as follows:
1. The disputed property has an area of 278.92 m² according to Document No. 2369, registered on 17/2/2009.
2. The disputed property is a government house located at the corner of two streets with a shared back courtyard and one neighboring unit on one side. The exterior cladding is beige stone, and it has 8 shaded parking spaces.
3. The disputed property consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a roof, and has 3 entrances: a main entrance, a separate diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> entrance, and a side entrance, with the following details:
a- The ground floor consists of a hall with its bathroom + rooms with their bathrooms + kitchen + maid's room.
b- An annex consisting of a room with its bathroom + a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with its bathroom.
c- The first floor consists of 3 bedrooms + a hall + a bathroom + a main kitchen.
d- The roof has a storage room and an air conditioning unit area.
4. Air conditioning units.
5. The first defendant stated that she resides on the first floor, while no one resides on the ground floor.
Secondly: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall start at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, calculated by depositing the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and expenses for advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall be responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment <orig>حكم رسو المزاد</orig> is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."

Ms. Khawla Mohammed Ibrahim Al-Tuwairish <orig>خوله محمد إبراهيم الطويرش</orig> appeared before the Sharia Documentation Department <orig>إدارة التوثيقات الشرعية</orig>, accompanied by two witnesses: Salem Mahdi Humaidan Al-Harbi <orig>سالم مهدي حميدان الحربي</orig> (Kuwaiti nationality) and Mufleh Faleh Mufleh Al-Azmi <orig>مفلح فالح مفلح العازمي</orig> (Kuwaiti nationality). She requested an inheritance delimitation for the deceased Mohammed Ibrahim Mohammed Al-Tuwairish <orig>محمد إبراهيم محمد الطويرش</orig> [Kuwaiti nationality], who passed away on 04/01/2025. His inheritance is limited to his adult daughters: Khawla <orig>خوله</orig>, Nawal <orig>نوال</orig>, Mona <orig>منى</orig>, Amal <orig>أمل</orig>, Asma <orig>أسماء</orig>, Nadia <orig>ناديه</orig>, Sarah <orig>ساره</orig>, and Noura <orig>نوره</orig>, with no other heirs except those mentioned.
The Department <orig>الإدارة</orig> hereby announces this for a period of two weeks from the date of publication in two consecutive issues of the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>. Anyone with an objection to what has been stated should submit it to the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> – Sharia Documentation Department <orig>إدارة التوثيقات الشرعية</orig>, stating their objection. After the aforementioned period has elapsed, the customary procedures in this regard will be taken. For clarification, we announce this.
Director of Sharia Documentation Department <orig>مدير إدارة التوثيقات الشرعية</orig>

# Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>
Announcement
The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> announces the publication of the announcement regarding the re-issuance of Practice No. PA/SAM - 91 / 2024-2025 <orig>هـ ع / ش أ م - 91 / 2024-2025</orig> concerning agricultural maintenance for the Third Al-Ardiya <orig>العارضية</orig> Area at the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>, according to the terms and specifications stated in the practice documents.
Companies and institutions wishing to participate in this practice should refer to the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> website (www.Paaet.edu.Kw) to purchase the practice tender listed under electronic services (general services). Bids must be submitted to the Authority's General Office <orig>ديوان عام الهيئة</orig> located in Shuwaikh Educational Area <orig>منطقة الشويخ التعليمية</orig> – Supplies Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات</orig> within two weeks from the date of publication of this announcement, against a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 75.000).
Director General

# Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig>
Announcement
The Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> announces the re-issuance of Practice No. PAS (11/2025/2026) <orig>هـ ع ر (2026/2025/11)</orig> concerning maintenance and equipping works for the Kuwaiti Fencing Federation <orig>الاتحاد الكويتي للمبارزة</orig> Hall, to be submitted in a sealed envelope according to the terms and specifications stated in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Services and Supplies Department <orig>إدارة الخدمات والتوريدات</orig> – Tenders and Practices Section <orig>قسم المناقصات والممارسات</orig> – Ground Floor, Office No. (5) at the Authority's headquarters in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقعي</orig> area during official working hours or through the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> website (Pas.gov.kw/tenders).

A preliminary meeting has been scheduled for the esteemed bidders at the Authority's headquarters (First Floor) at 11:30 AM on Sunday, 2025/5/25.
Bids must be submitted from 9:00 AM until 2:00 PM on the closing date. Bids must be delivered in sealed envelopes with red wax and placed in the box designated for practices at the Authority's headquarters (Ground Floor). No bids received after the specified closing time for the practice will be accepted.
*   Bidders must adhere to the instructions regarding bid submission (CD) on the website of the Public Authority for Sport / Al-Hai'a Al-Amma Lil-Riyadha <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> (Pas.gov.kw/tenders).
*   Companies / bidders wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must do so at the time and place specified above in the preliminary meeting schedule (inquiry session), and no inquiries will be considered after the deadline.
*   All documents must be submitted on a (CD) and a non-reproducible hard copy, except for the bid form and initial guarantee, which must be submitted as a hard copy.
Bids shall be valid for (90) ninety days from the date of bid opening. Any bid not accompanied by the original or a copy of the receipt for purchasing the practice documents, the initial guarantee, and the national labor support certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower / Al-Hai'a Al-Amma Lil-Quwa Al-Amila <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> for the year 2025 will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower / Al-Hai'a Al-Amma Lil-Quwa Al-Amila <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority or any of the violations mentioned in Article (10) of Law No. 8 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector, and it should be noted that bids not including this certificate will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy / Wizarat Al-Kahraba' wal-Ma' wal-Taqa Al-Mutajaddida <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> stating clearance from consumption debts.
The practice is open to all companies and establishments specialized in the required works and registered with the Public Authority for Sport / Al-Hai'a Al-Amma Lil-Riyadha <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders / Al-Jihaz Al-Markazi Lil-Munakasat Al-Amma <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025, for a fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, payable via K-Net (non-refundable except in cases stipulated by circulars of the Ministry of Finance / Wizarat Al-Maliya <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>), bringing with them the following:
1- A copy of the practice announcement in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
2- A copy of the company's registration with the Authority for the year 2025.
3- A written letter of approved authorization with the Authority, accompanied by (a copy of the Civil ID – a copy of the signature authorization).
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) are exempt from the prescribed fees for purchasing practice documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. (49/2016).
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) wishing to apply for the practice must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for SME Care and Development / Al-Sunduq Al-Watani Li-Ri'ayat wa Tanmiyat Al-Mashru'at Al-Saghira wal-Mutawassita <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, including approval of a small or medium project they own, in accordance with the text of Article (48) of Public Tenders Law No. (49 of 2016) which states: "Bid envelopes shall be opened at the time and place specified in the practice documents in a public session in the presence of bidders or their representatives."
*   This announcement is considered an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to coordinate with the competent committee before the session date to attend the bid opening session.
*   This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
Note: The Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة</orig> may do so without stating reasons and without any objection from the bidders.
*   For more information, please visit the website of the Public Authority for Sport / Al-Hai'a Al-Amma Lil-Riyadha <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> (Pas.gov.kw).

In accordance with the text of Article (48) of the Public Tenders Law No. (49 of 2016 AD), which stipulates: "Tender envelopes shall be opened at the time and place specified in the practice documents in a public session attended by the bidders or their representatives."
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested practitioners to attend, as it is the right of interested participants to coordinate with the competent committee one day prior to the session for opening envelopes.
- This announcement is an integral part of the practice documents.
- Note: The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from the practitioners.
- For more information, please visit the website of the Public Authority for Sport / Al-Hay'a Al-'Amma lil-Riyadha <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> (Pas.gov.kw).

The practitioner must submit a recent certificate of no objection (to whom it may concern) issued by the Public Authority for Manpower / Al-Hay'a Al-'Amma lil-Quwa Al-'Amila <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the company's file regarding government contracts registered with the Public Authority for Manpower / Al-Hay'a Al-'Amma lil-Quwa Al-'Amila <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, and a recent certificate of no objection (to whom it may concern) confirming compliance with the national labor percentage, contemporary to the date of the bid. The practitioner must also deposit with their bid an initial security deposit in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, unreserved, and irrevocable letter of guarantee issued in the name of the bidder by one of the banks approved by the State of Kuwait and in favor of the Public Authority for Industry / Al-Hay'a Al-'Amma lil-Sina'a <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>, valid for the duration of the bid. Any bid not accompanied by the full security deposit will be excluded. The initial security deposit may not be refunded until (90) days have passed from the date of closing the practice or when the winning practitioner signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. The Authority will not pay any interest on the amount of this security, and the practitioner's creditors may not seize its amount, noting that this practice is indivisible.

Acting Deputy Director General for Financial and Administrative Affairs

The Public Authority for Civil Information / Al-Hay'a Al-'Amma lil-Ma'lumat Al-Madaniyah <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces that the individuals whose names are listed below have had their residential addresses canceled (based on the declaration of the property owner or due to building demolition). <header>
116
Sunday, 27 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH - 25/5/2025 AD
Al-Kuwait Al-Youm / Kuwait Today <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue No. 1740, Seventy-First Year
</header>
for the Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> to sell the goods in one lot or several lots, depending on the circumstances of the sale.
2. The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall bear a brokerage commission <orig>عمولة دلالة</orig> of 2% of the sale price.
3. The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> must pay the value of the goods via K-net <orig>الكي- نت</orig> only, as determined by the Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig>.
4. The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> must remove the goods from the premises of the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department <orig>مراقبة بيت المال</orig> urgently and within 5 (five) to 7 (seven) days after the auction is awarded to them. Otherwise, any goods will be seized and sold in the next auction if the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> fails to remove them within the specified period.
5. No buyer to whom goods have been awarded is permitted to assign or resell them to a third party until they have been removed from the premises of the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department <orig>مراقبة بيت المال</orig> affiliated with the Administration <orig>الإدارة</orig>.
6. If the goods are not sold for any reason in the auction, the Committee has the right to offer them for sale in the subsequent auction.
7. The Administration <orig>الإدارة</orig> has the right to stop, postpone, or re-schedule the sale at another time if a suitable price is not obtained or for any reasons it deems contrary to its interest.
8. The Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may cancel or postpone the auction for any reason it deems appropriate.
9. Since the goods will be sold as-is, bidders must inspect them to ascertain their condition, quality, and type at the aforementioned address during the auction sale.
10. In the event that the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> refrains from paying the sale price or part thereof, the General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig> has the right to resell the goods at their expense. If the price does not reach the amount for which the auction was initially awarded, they shall be obligated to pay the difference. In this case, the Administration <orig>الإدارة</orig> has the right to bar them from participating in any future auctions.
11. The Administration <orig>الإدارة</orig> is not responsible for any action or use of the sold goods that violates applicable laws and legislations.
12. This sale is conducted in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 10 of 2003 <orig>القانون رقم 10 لسنة 2003</orig> concerning the Unified Customs System <orig>النظام الموحد للجمارك</orig> and its regulating decisions.

## General Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>
### Announcement
The General Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (01 - 2025 / 2026) concerning the renewal of licenses for the Security Information Monitoring and Analysis System, maintenance of intrusion prevention system devices, and provision of technical support.
Companies wishing to participate must collect the documents from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> - Ground Floor at the General Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> building in Block (2), District (1) during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 25/05/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) (Seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> only).
Bids must be submitted to the headquarters of the General Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> located in Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig>, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2000 K.D.) in the form of an unconditional letter of guarantee or certified check issued by one of the accredited local banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. It should be valid for the entire duration of the offer, and offers shall be valid for (90) ninety days from the date of opening their envelopes. Bids must be placed inside a single envelope sealed with red wax and addressed externally to the General Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>, mentioning the subject as indicated above, while avoiding the name of the bidder or any indication thereof. The deadline for submitting offers is 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 10/06/2025.
All participants in this practice must attend the preliminary meeting, which will be held at 10:00 AM on Sunday, 01/06/2025, at the headquarters of the General Authority for Anti-Corruption (Nazaha <orig>نزاهة</orig>) - Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig>. The participant is considered bound by what is stated in the meeting minutes and the compilation of documents for this practice, whether they attended this meeting or not.
Secretary General <orig>الأمين العام</orig>

Therefore, companies / establishments wishing to be registered in the suppliers' register of Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> should refer to the Procurement and Stores Department <orig>دائرة المشتريات والمخازن</orig> – Purchase Requests Section at the Institute's main headquarters in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> (Administrative Building – Third Floor) to obtain registration or renewal applications from the Institute or to follow the Institute's website << _ _ Procurement and Stores <orig>المشتريات والمخازن</orig> _ _ >> – Registration Form or Company Data Renewal Form.
The following documents must be attached to the registration application:
1) Copy of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig> certificate for 2025
2) Copy of the company's articles of association
3) Commercial license from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>
4) Copies of commercial agency registration certificates (for suppliers)
5) Signature authorization on behalf of the company / establishment.
6) Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> classification certificate (if any) for contractors
7) Municipality classification certificate indicating the category for contractors.
8) Import license for suppliers
9) Financial status based on certificates from banks dealing with the company / establishment, along with certified balance sheets and profit and loss accounts for the past three years
10) Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> registration for companies specializing in computer hardware and systems
11) Ministry of Communications <orig>وزارة المواصلات</orig> registration for companies specializing in communication devices
12) Previous experience and contracts (copies of contracts)
Fees are to be paid at the Cashier's Office <orig>أمانة الصندوق</orig> at the Institute's headquarters in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> area as follows:
- Company registration fees (30 K.D.) (thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
- Company renewal fees (10 K.D.) (ten Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only).
The payment receipt and the registration and renewal forms are to be submitted at the Institute's main headquarters in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> (Administrative Building – Procurement and Stores Department <orig>دائرة المشتريات والمخازن</orig> – Third Floor).

*   Based on the text of Article (29) of Law No. 49 of 2016 regarding Public Tenders <orig>المناقصات العامة</orig>, no single person or group of persons acting jointly may register under more than one name during classification or submit more than one bid in a tender, except for alternative bids where the tender conditions permit their submission. However, a person who has a share in separate companies, each independent with its legal personality, finances, engineers, employees, and general administrative apparatus, may register himself and each of his independent companies during classification. Any bid submitted by a tenderer in violation of this shall be deemed null and void by operation of law.
